text: If you're so afraid of failure, you will never succeed. You have to take chances.

text: I don't think it's in any way harmful, this marriage of media and politicians. I think it enhances the communications process considerably and makes it possible for the public to be far more aware, far more up-to-date on issues and the opposite sides of the issues.

text: It is easy to hate and it is difficult to love. This is how the whole scheme of things works. All good things are difficult to achieve; and bad things are very easy to get.

text: I teach students that what people say about failure in politics is mostly wrong. People always told me, 'They'll praise you on your way up and kick you on your way down.' That wasn't my experience. I can't walk down the street in Toronto without someone coming up and saying hello.

text: To measure the success of our societies, we should examine how well those with different abilities, including persons with autism, are integrated as full and valued members.

text: I'm a foodie. I enjoy it a lot, and contrary to what it looks, I eat a lot. My comfort food, of all things, would be southern soul barbecue.

text: In complete darkness, it is only knowledge and wisdom that separates us.

text: Priesthood quorums teach and assist their members to attain good health, financial stability, and a year's supply of food and clothing. They also teach their members to be self-reliant and to give their time, talents, and means in behalf of the Church, community, and needy.

text: You don't need a silver fork to eat good food.
author: Paul Prudhomme

text: I'm a little self-conscious about my body. I love to wear hoodies because you can get cozy and eat some food and your belly doesn't show!

text: I think that gay marriage should be between a man and a woman.

text: The biggest misconception people have about me is that when they see how young I am, they think, 'Oh, this guy must have always wanted to be in politics; his parents must have been politically connected.' I'm a finance major and always intended to go into business.

text: For me, good films and good books are irreducible to a lesson. You can't just kind of translate them into one statement. On the contrary, the more you do that, the less wisdom in art there is.

text: The Gross National Product measures neither our wit nor our courage, neither our wisdom nor our learning, neither our compassion nor our devotion to our country. text: I may not have proved a great explorer, but we have done the greatest march ever made and come very near to great success.

text: Well I think in a marriage you have to be honest and ask yourself, you know, what is my role? What is my responsibility?

text: In almost every marriage there is a selfish and an unselfish partner. A pattern is set up and soon becomes inflexible, of one person always making the demands and one person always giving way.

text: We humans have lost the wisdom of genuinely resting and relaxing. We worry too much. We don't allow our bodies to heal, and we don't allow our minds and hearts to heal.

text: I think that Obama's failure to reestablish the rule of law in money matters is the most damaging thing that he's done - and perhaps the most damaging thing that has happened in American politics in my lifetime. text: A man of great memory without learning hath a rock and a spindle and no staff to spin.
author: George Herbert

text: Look, Congress has allocated more money to finance the upcoming Iraqi elections than it has for the American elections. There's something wrong with that.

text: We are constituted so that simple acts of kindness, such as giving to charity or expressing gratitude, have a positive effect on our long-term moods. The key to the happy life, it seems, is the good life: a life with sustained relationships, challenging work, and connections to community.

text: Watching John Lasseter's films, I think I can understand better than anyone that what he's doing, is going straight ahead with his vision and working really hard to get that vision into film form. And I feel that my understanding this of him is my friendship towards him.

text: When you come off 'The X Factor,' you're more likely to be a failure than a success because people almost want you to fail. There's this kind of feeling that you're separate from everyone else. You get it from artists, people in the industry, people at record labels.

text: The main reason for the failure of the modern medical science is that it is dealing with results and not causes. Nothing more than the patching up of those attacked and the burying of those who are slain, without a thought being given to the real strong hold.

text: I failed the LSAT. Basically, if I had not failed, I'd have been a lawyer and there would be no Spanx. I think failure is nothing more than life's way of nudging you that you are off course. My attitude to failure is not attached to outcome, but in not trying. It is liberating.

text: I would have told him that I appreciated his friendship through the years and that I had learned a lot from him. I really loved Frank like you do a brother.

text: My parents, and librarians along the way, taught me about the space between words; about the margins, where so many juicy moments of life and spirit and friendship could be found. text: Give a little love to a child, and you get a great deal back.

text: You accept failure as a possible outcome of some of the experiments. If you don't get failures, you're not pushing hard enough on the objectives.

text: What does love look like? It has the hands to help others. It has the feet to hasten to the poor and needy. It has eyes to see misery and want. It has the ears to hear the sighs and sorrows of men. That is what love looks like.

text: I used to pre-rehearse everything and then bring my pre-rehearsed performance to the set. Now, I'm learning to let it happen in the moment. text: Bad faith likes discourse on friendship and loyalty.

text: Just as the unique characteristics of both males and females contribute to the completeness of a marriage relationship, so those same characteristics are vital to the rearing, nurturing, and teaching of children.

text: Daring to set boundaries is about having the courage to love ourselves, even when we risk disappointing others.

text: The secret to success, to parenting, to life, is to not count up the cost. Don't focus on all the steps it will take. Don't stare into the abyss at the giant leap it will take. That view will keep you from taking the next small step.

text: A good memory is surely a compost heap that converts experience to wisdom, creativity, or dottiness; not that these things are of much earthly value, but at least they may keep you amused when the world is keeping you locked away or shutting you out.

text: I never feel lonely if I've got a book - they're like old friends. Even if you're not reading them over and over again, you know they are there. And they're part of your history. They sort of tell a story about your journey through life.

text: We'll continue to heal human bodies through biotechnology but we'll also increasingly feed, clothe and house the world through bioengineered systems. Ultimately, there's no reason why live animals should be used in any part of our food or goods chain and we're working to make that a reality.

text: Save the Children is an awesome charity that has helped more than 125 million children around the world, providing everything from school books to food to blankets and shelter.

text: To enter upon the marriage union is one of the most deeply important events of life. It cannot be too prayerfully treated. text: The wisdom of the wise is an uncommon degree of common sense.

text: Students and postdoctoral fellows largely depend on the support of the public sector to finance the training and research that will make them world-renowned scientists.

text: A man cannot be said to succeed in this life who does not satisfy one friend.

text: The objectification of females is not a good thing! text: Success on one project does not necessarily mean success in the next project. You've got to be prepared in everything you do.

text: Our strength in finance has led us to set up an international financial centre with medium and long-term objectives, especially to develop Islamic financial and insurance services.

text: Marriage is the most obvious public practice about which information is readily available. text: You must learn day by day, year by year to broaden your horizon. The more things you love, the more you are interested in, the more you enjoy, the more you are indignant about, the more you have left when anything happens.

text: The next Bill Gates will not start an operating system. The next Larry Page won't start a search engine. The next Mark Zuckerberg won't start a social network company. If you are copying these people, you are not learning from them.

text: Become slower in your journey through life. Practice yoga and meditation if you suffer from 'hurry sickness.' Become more introspective by visiting quiet places such as churches, museums, mountains and lakes. Give yourself permission to read at least one novel a month for pleasure.

text: I grew and learned, journeyed and understood, that someone who is afraid of failing won't get anywhere, and someone who dares to do it runs the risk of failure if they don't learn, correct their mistakes, and get back up.

text: Never does nature say one thing and wisdom another.

text: The more natural or eco-based products you can introduce into your beauty regimen, the more beneficial it is for your skin. It's similar to introducing organic food into your daily diet.

author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Kids don't need to be taught the value of making; they are natural makers, at least until traditional education makes them afraid of making mistakes. The long-term value of making for kids is in learning to become an active participant in the world around them rather than a consumer of prepackaged products and solutions.
author: Mark Frauenfelder

text: My mother never met a gadget she didn't like. There were tube pans for baking the angel food cakes my father could have after his first heart attack, and Bundt pans and loaf pans and baking pans and grilling pans.
author: Janet Fitch

text: There is a huge difference between failing and failure. Failing is trying something that you learn doesn't work. Failure is throwing in the towel and giving up. True success comes from failing repeatedly and as quickly as possible, before your cash or your willpower runs out.
author: Jay Samit

text: Life changes so quickly. feeling grateful to be around such wonderful people to strengthen and grow with.
author: Riley Keough

text: Most small business owners are not particularly sophisticated business people. That's not a criticism; they're passionate about cutting hair or cooking food, and that's why they got in the business, not because they have an MBA.
author: Andrew Mason

text: Nothing helps make a leader more approachable than admitting your struggles, screw-ups and behind-the-scenes thinking on hard calls. If the leader makes this a priority, the whole company will be more open and methodical learning from failure.
author: Scott Weiss

text: Every soldier must know, before he goes into battle, how the little battle he is to fight fits into the larger picture, and how the success of his fighting will influence the battle as a whole.
author: Bernard Law Montgomery

text: I like being able to walk into an old town and find good local food.
author: Sienna Miller

text: Whatever the long-term legal prospects for same-sex marriage, President Obama's willingness to put the matter front and center in an election year can at least make him a candidate for inclusion in Kennedy's Profiles in Courage.
author: Robert Dallek

text: I feel like I've lived a life of making mistakes and learning from them and doing my best to only make each mistake once.
author: Bre Pettis

text: We were all born with a certain degree of power. The key to success is discovering this innate power and using it daily to deal with whatever challenges come our way.
author: Les Brown

text: I believe any success in life is made by going into an area with a blind, furious optimism.
author: Sylvester Stallone

text: We need to have an educational system that's able to embrace all sorts of minds, and where a student doesn't have to fit into a certain mold of learning.
author: James Hillman

text: Success is peace of mind, which is a direct result of self-satisfaction in knowing you made the effort to become the best of which you are capable.
author: John Wooden

text: Many a friendship, long, loyal, and self-sacrificing, rested at first on no thicker a foundation than a kind word.
author: Frederick William Faber

text: For the poor, learning to manage money well is central to improving their lives.
author: Ann Cotton

text: A friend in power is a friend lost.
author: Henry Adams

text: You don't have to go looking for love when it's where you come from.
author: Werner Erhard

text: It's so different when you change your hair color, you're treated so differently. It's a very funny experience. It's fun - I love changing up my hair.
author: Kate Bosworth

text: The gateways to wisdom and learning are always open, and more and more I am choosing to walk through them. Barriers, blocks, obstacles, and problems are personal teachers giving me the opportunity to move out of the past and into the Totality of Possibilities.
author: Louise L. Hay

text: I'm frugal. I'm not a very acquisitive woman. I never waste food. If you prepare your own food, you engage with the world, it tastes alive. It tastes good.
author: Vivienne Westwood

text: To be prepared is half the victory.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

text: Life is full of adventure. There's no such thing as a clear pathway.
author: Guy Laliberte

text: Most regular, two-year MBA programs provide both experience and the capacity to link together the essential elements of management such as finance, marketing, organizational behavior, and operations.
author: Warren Bennis

text: We're constantly striving for success, fame and comfort when all we really need to be happy is someone or some thing to be enthusiastic about.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

text: For me, success is a state of mind. I feel like success isn't about conquering something; it's being happy with who you are.
author: Britney Spears

text: I emphasize that virtually every engineering calculation is ultimately a failure calculation, because without a failure criterion against which to measure the calculated result, it is a meaningless number.
author: Henry Petroski

text: The beauty of age is we grow, we learn. We have more wisdom. And as much as the youth-glorifying Hollywood would like us to believe, it's nothing. They're wrong.
author: Sherilyn Fenn

text: Failure usually works for me in the end.
author: David Hasselhoff

text: I think you're working and learning until you die.
author: J. K. Rowling

text: Personally, I experience success when I enjoy what I'm doing. I love the creative process, even if the end result isn't embraced by anyone else.
author: RuPaul

text: It was not my wish to come into politics. I was not a public person; I preferred to spend my birthdays with family and friends. But the 2008 elections were fraudulent, so I decided to finance the opposition to make them stronger.
author: Bidzina Ivanishvili

text: Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.
author: Mother Teresa

text: In this world it is not what we take up, but what we give up, that makes us rich.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

text: Fueled by the kindness and generosity of strangers, 'Food for the Poor' builds houses for people.
author: Mike Gallagher

text: Like Lyndon Johnson, President Obama understands that timidity in a time of troubles is a prescription for failure.
author: Robert Dallek

text: The sad truth is that the civil rights movement cannot be reborn until we identify the causes of black suffering, some of them self-inflicted. Why can't black leaders organize rallies around responsible sexuality, birth within marriage, parents reading to their children and students staying in school and doing homework?
author: Henry Louis Gates

text: All the teaching I had ever received had failed to make me apply such intelligence as I was possessed of, directly and vividly: there had never been any sunshine, as regards language, in the earlier grey days of learning, for the sky had always pelted with gerunds and optatives.
author: E. F. Benson

text: What I cannot love, I overlook. Is that real friendship?
author: Anais Nin

text: Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence.
author: David Byrne

text: What is indisputable is the fact that unbelief is the force that gives birth to all of our bad behavior and every moral failure. It is the root.
author: Tullian Tchividjian

text: Art is like a stock with a decent return for people in finance, and they get to feel like they are involved with culture, spend time with artists, as part of their dividend.
author: Rachel Kushner

text: While the public school rewards failure by throwing more government money at failing school systems, the voucher system does the opposite.
author: Fabrizio Moreira

text: All the children of the great men in Persia are brought up at court, where they have an opportunity of learning great modesty, and where nothing immodest is ever heard or seen.
author: Xenophon

text: Ideology, politics and journalism, which luxuriate in failure, are impotent in the face of hope and joy.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

text: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.
author: William James

text: Your success story is a bigger story than whatever you're trying to say on stage. Success makes life easier. It doesn't make living easier.
author: Bruce Springsteen

text: Some people think football is a matter of life and death. I assure you, it's much more serious than that.
author: Bill Shankly

text: Marriage, it seems, confines every man to his proper rank.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

text: Whether one admired or was repulsed by the positions he took on matters foreign and domestic, it is undeniable that Reagan's ability to project anger was highly attractive to his most passionate supporters on the far right - and crucial to his political success.
author: Jackson Katz

text: The art of life is to know how to enjoy a little and to endure very much.
author: William Hazlitt

text: Even in the common affairs of life, in love, friendship, and marriage, how little security have we when we trust our happiness in the hands of others!
author: William Hazlitt

text: I've always believed that human learning is the result of relatively simple rules combined with massive amounts of hardware and massive amounts of data.
author: Sebastian Thrun

text: Every time you use the word 'healthy,' you lose. The key is to make yummy, delicious food that happens to be healthy.
author: Marcus Samuelsson

text: The high arts of literature and music stand in a curious relationship to one another, at once securely comfortable and deeply uneasy - rather like a long-term marriage.
author: Will Self

text: The lesson of history is that you do not get a sustained economic recovery as long as the financial system is in crisis.
author: Ben Bernanke

text: Never be a food snob. Learn from everyone you meet - the fish guy at your market, the lady at the local diner, farmers, cheese makers. Ask questions, try everything and eat up!
author: Rachael Ray

text: In the beginning, Adam was instructed to earn the bread by the sweat of his brow - not Eve. Contrary to conventional wisdom, a mother's place is in the home!
author: Ezra Taft Benson

text: Do the bishops seriously imagine that legalising gay marriage will result in thousands of parties to heterosexual marriages suddenly deciding to get divorced so they can marry a person of the same sex?
author: Malcolm Turnbull

text: Failure is impossible.
author: Susan B. Anthony

text: I really wanted to make the worst thing: the thing that even people who liked bad, terrible music wouldn't like - the stuff that people would ignore, always. Something really, really stupid. Something that is destined for failure.
author: Ariel Pink

text: All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on.
author: Havelock Ellis

text: Marriage is like a game of chess except the board is flowing water, the pieces are made of smoke and no move you make will have any effect on the outcome.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

text: Urban conservationists may feel entitled to be unconcerned about food production because they are not farmers. But they can't be let off so easily, for they are all farming by proxy.
author: Wendell Berry

text: Honesty and integrity are absolutely essential for success in life - all areas of life. The really good news is that anyone can develop both honesty and integrity.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: There's not an instruction manual on how to deal with success, so you just have to rely on having great friends and a good team.
author: Bryan Adams

text: I understand that there's a certain energy in youth, no question, in terms of pursuing jobs. But there is wisdom in age. It's too bad that the two can't come together because I do think that people are dropped from what they're really good at too soon.
author: Rene Russo

text: What we play is life.
author: Louis Armstrong

text: A man with a silver spoon may get his share of supporters, but he can never be an inspiration for somebody! Patience and hard work are the key to every man's success.
author: Kailash Kher

text: Being a survivor doesn't mean being strong - it's telling people when you need a meal or a ride, company, whatever. It's paying attention to heart wisdom, feelings, not living a role, but having a unique, authentic life, having something to contribute, finding time to love and laugh. All these things are qualities of survivors.
author: Bernie Siegel

text: Movies are not novels, and that's why, when filmmakers try to adapt novels, particularly long or complex novels, the result is almost always failure. It can't be done.
author: Paul Auster

text: Alcohol may be man's worst enemy, but the bible says love your enemy.
author: Frank Sinatra

text: Spain is a fascinating mix of people, languages, culture and food, but if there is one thing all Spaniards share, it's a love of food and drink.
author: Jose Andres

text: I think it's best if there's an amendment that goes on the ballot where the people can weigh in. Every time this issue has gone on the ballot, the people have voted to retain the traditional definition of marriage as recently as California in 2008.
author: Michele Bachmann

text: I believe in using words, not fists. I believe in my outrage knowing people are living in boxes on the street. I believe in honesty. I believe in a good time. I believe in good food. I believe in sex.
author: Bertrand Russell

text: Failures, repeated failures, are finger posts on the road to achievement. One fails forward toward success.
author: C. S. Lewis

text: Not engaging in ignorance is wisdom.
author: Bodhidharma

text: Honesty is about the scars. It's about the blemishes. But it's more than just bragging about failure, which could be a form of ego. It's about truly helping people.
author: James Altucher

text: When we remember we are all mad, the mysteries disappear and life stands explained.
author: Mark Twain

text: Fame or perceived success - it all comes from groupthink.
author: Chance The Rapper

text: Those who have never known the deep intimacy and the intense companionship of mutual love have missed the best thing that life has to give.
author: Bertrand Russell

text: There have been a lot of critiques of the finance industry's having possibly foisted subprime mortgages on unknowing buyers, and a lot of those kinds of arguments are even more powerful when used against college administrators who are probably in some ways engaged in equally misleading advertising.
author: Peter Thiel

text: I want to use my connections with coaches, players, celebrities, whomever, and if I can take that friendship and use it to help someone else, I'm going to take advantage of that. I'm not going to apologize for that.
author: Tim Tebow

text: The failure of Lehman Brothers demonstrated that liquidity provision by the Federal Reserve would not be sufficient to stop the crisis; substantial fiscal resources were necessary.
author: Ben Bernanke

text: Marriage, in life, is like a duel in the midst of a battle.
author: Edmond About

text: There is not to be found, in all history, any miracle attested by a sufficient number of men, of such unquestioned good sense, education and learning, as to secure us against all delusion in themselves.
author: David Hume

text: If thou must love me, let it be for naught except for love's sake only.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

text: Most of our pocket wisdom is conceived for the use of mediocre people, to discourage them from ambitious attempts, and generally console them in their mediocrity.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: Of course, with well-masticated food playing the role of social glue, it's absolutely essential that everyone clear their plate. Sod the starving kiddies in Africa - it's the overfed ones here we need to worry about.
author: Will Self

text: Because of the dog's joyfulness, our own is increased. It is no small gift. It is not the least reason why we should honor as love the dog of our own life, and the dog down the street, and all the dogs not yet born.
author: Mary Oliver

text: The introduction of many minds into many fields of learning along a broad spectrum keeps alive questions about the accessibility, if not the unity, of knowledge.
author: Edward Levi

text: When you have a baby, when you feel his love, you feel so at peace with the world. You just want to share the good news and share how happy you feel.
author: Shakira

text: I've had to learn to fight all my life - got to learn to keep smiling. If you smile things will work out.
author: Serena Williams

text: The most powerful weapon on earth is the human soul on fire.
author: Ferdinand Foch

text: There is no question that creative intelligence comes not through learning things you find in books or histories that have already been written, but by focusing on and giving value to experience as it happens.
author: Antony Gormley

text: Man is wise and constantly in quest of more wisdom; but the ultimate wisdom, which deals with beginnings, remains locked in a seed. There it lies, the simplest fact of the universe and at the same time the one which calls forth faith rather than reason.
author: Hal Borland

text: In the 18th century, people began to adopt the radical new idea that love should be the most fundamental reason for marriage and that young people should be free to choose their marriage partners independently.
author: Jardine Libaire

text: No, there's nothing half so sweet in life as love's young dream.
author: Thomas Moore

text: The two most misused words in the entire English vocabulary are love and friendship. A true friend would die for you, so when you start trying to count them on one hand, you don't need any fingers.
author: Larry Flynt

text: One measure of friendship consists not in the number of things friends can discuss, but in the number of things they need no longer mention.
author: Clifton Fadiman

text: Sometimes I am happy and sometimes not. I am, after all, a human being, you know. And I am glad that we are sometimes happy and sometimes not. You get your wisdom working by having different emotions.

text: I don't like food that's too carefully arranged; it makes me think that the chef is spending too much time arranging and not enough time cooking. If I wanted a picture I'd buy a painting.
author: Andy Rooney

text: Marriage is not a noun; it's a verb. It isn't something you get. It's something you do. It's the way you love your partner every day.
author: Barbara De Angelis

text: At the center of non-violence stands the principle of love.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: A dog is the only thing on earth that loves you more than you love yourself.
author: Josh Billings

text: You can forgive people who do not follow you through a philosophical disquisition; but to find your wife laughing when you had tears in your eyes, or staring when you were in a fit of laughter, would go some way towards a dissolution of the marriage.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: The seat of knowledge is in the head; of wisdom, in the heart. We are sure to judge wrong, if we do not feel right.
author: William Hazlitt

text: We need to accept that we won't always make the right decisions, that we'll screw up royally sometimes - understanding that failure is not the opposite of success, it's part of success.
author: Arianna Huffington

text: Let my skin and sinews and bones dry up, together with all the flesh and blood of my body! I welcome it! But I will not move from this spot until I have attained the supreme and final wisdom.
author: Buddha

text: The secrets of success are a good wife and a steady job. My wife told me.
author: Howard Nemerov

text: There is only one happiness in this life, to love and be loved.
author: George Sand

text: Love is the child of illusion and the parent of disillusion.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

text: Times of transition are strenuous, but I love them. They are an opportunity to purge, rethink priorities, and be intentional about new habits. We can make our new normal any way we want.
author: Kristin Armstrong

text: We may encounter many defeats but we must not be defeated.
author: Maya Angelou

text: I don't know if I believe in marriage. I believe in family, love and children.
author: Penelope Cruz

text: I was a vegetarian first. I had high blood pressure at 27, everybody in my family died of cancer, and I knew it was in the food, so I changed my diet.
author: John Salley

text: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
author: Socrates

text: As we say in the American Institute of Wine and Food, small helpings, no seconds. A little bit of everything. No snacking. And have a good time.
author: Julia Child

text: I will give you a definition of a proud man: he is a man who has neither vanity nor wisdom one filled with hatreds cannot be vain, neither can he be wise.
author: John Keats

text: Music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

text: My real adversary has no name, no face, no party. It will never be elected, yet it governs - the adversary is the world of finance.
author: Francois Hollande

text: Fear of failure, it's the greatest motivational tool. It drives me and drives me and drives me.
author: Jerry West

text: Any time not spent on love is wasted.
author: Torquato Tasso

text: In a crowded marketplace, fitting in is a failure. In a busy marketplace, not standing out is the same as being invisible.
author: Seth Godin

text: Life is not easy for any of us. But what of that? We must have perseverance and above all confidence in ourselves. We must believe that we are gifted for something and that this thing must be attained.
author: Marie Curie

text: The man who has won millions at the cost of his conscience is a failure.
author: B. C. Forbes

text: Everyone says you've got to do a foundation and legal structure to finance social change. What nonsense!
author: Bill Drayton

text: The best way to obtain truth and wisdom is not to ask from books, but to go to God in prayer, and obtain divine teaching.
author: Joseph Smith, Jr.

text: The government is also looking at further benefits including enhanced capital allowances; the use of Tax Incremental Finance; and extra help from UK Trade and Investment on inward investment and trade opportunities.
author: Andy Sawford

text: Financial support is one thing, but I always think what becomes really sacrificial is your time.
author: Cliff Richard

text: I honestly think it is better to be a failure at something you love than to be a success at something you hate.
author: George Burns

text: Our nation's Social Security Trust Fund is depleting at an alarming rate, and failure to implement immediate reforms endangers the ability of Americans to plan for their retirement with the options and certainty they deserve.
author: Pete Sessions

text: I have not supported same-sex marriage. I have supported civil partnerships and contractual relationships.
author: Hillary Clinton

text: The road to success is always under construction.
author: Lily Tomlin

text: Super-ambitious goals tend to be unifying and energizing to people; but only if they believe there's a chance of success.
author: Peter Diamandis

text: True, a little learning is a dangerous thing, but it still beats total ignorance.
author: Pauline Phillips

text: Obviously, if I'm in Argentina, I'm going to have a steak, but I don't love meat, really. I always think about where the food came from and who had to get it.
author: Julia Stiles

text: Those who cannot work with their hearts achieve but a hollow, half-hearted success that breeds bitterness all around.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

text: Friendship's the wine of life: but friendship new... is neither strong nor pure.
author: Edward Young

text: I'm less worried about accomplishment - as younger people always can't help but be - and more concerned with spending my time well, spending time with my family, and reading, learning things.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

text: In every aspect of my life, I live under the protection of and in accordance to the laws of this nation. At the end of the day, it's a wildlife biological fact and a conservation fact that the game must be managed. There's only so much habitat, i.e. food, out there.
author: Shawn Michaels

text: I'm certain that most couples expect to find intimacy in marriage, but it somehow eludes them.
author: James Dobson

text: Wisdom lies neither in fixity nor in change, but in the dialectic between the two.
author: Octavio Paz

text: Make space in your life for the things that matter, for family and friends, love and generosity, fun and joy. Without this, you will burn out in mid-career and wonder where your life went.
author: Jonathan Sacks

text: No man is a failure who is enjoying life.
author: William Feather

text: The great thing about baseball is the causality is easy to determine and it always falls on the shoulders of one person. So there is absolute responsibility. That's why baseball is psychologically the cruelest sport and why it really requires psychological resources to play baseball - because you have to learn to live with failure.
author: Michael Mandelbaum

text: I wonder how many times people give up just before a breakthrough - when they are on the very brink of success.
author: Joyce Meyer

text: Success is all about persistence and doing the right thing for the long term.
author: Bruce Rauner

text: I'd rather attempt to do something great and fail than to attempt to do nothing and succeed.
author: Robert H. Schuller

text: We can bring positive energy into our daily lives by smiling more, talking to strangers in line, replacing handshakes with hugs, and calling our friends just to tell them we love them.
author: Brandon Jenner

text: What is important in life is life, and not the result of life.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: As an entrepreneur, you never stop learning.
author: Daymond John

text: I am a woman in process. I'm just trying like everybody else. I try to take every conflict, every experience, and learn from it. Life is never dull.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: If a relationship is going wrong, if a marriage is going wrong, the answer cannot simply be to say, 'You can't afford to break up because you are going to lose the house.' The answer has to be only one thing, which is 'I love you.'
author: Rory Stewart

text: Tokyo would probably be the foreign city if I had to eat one city's food for the rest of my life, every day. It would have to be Tokyo, and I think the majority of chefs you ask that question would answer the same way.
author: Anthony Bourdain

text: I think everything that you do, you're learning. I mean, every movie that you make is like a film school; that's one of the things that I enjoy about filmmaking.
author: Peter Jackson

text: Success is the result of perfection, hard work, learning from failure, loyalty, and persistence.
author: Colin Powell

text: True, we love life, not because we are used to living, but because we are used to loving. There is always some madness in love, but there is also always some reason in madness.
author: Petrarch

text: It's easy to impress me. I don't need a fancy party to be happy. Just good friends, good food, and good laughs. I'm happy. I'm satisfied. I'm content.
author: Maria Sharapova

text: Money and success don't change people; they merely amplify what is already there.
author: Will Smith

text: Same-sex marriage is not the future.
author: Maggie Gallagher

text: Every act of conscious learning requires the willingness to suffer an injury to one's self-esteem. That is why young children, before they are aware of their own self-importance, learn so easily.
author: Thomas Szasz

text: Sometimes I get extremely disturbed with the things that are written. But you can't do anything about it. As a celebrity, you are putting yourself out there to be judged, and that's fine. I am now learning not to get affected by such things. I am building my career and making choices that I think are right while minding my own business.
author: Anushka Sharma

text: I have an American son and an American partner, so marriage might logistically make sense at one point. My partner is a stay-at-home father, so if he wants to be on my health plan, or tax wise, or maybe on paper we want to have our I's dotted and our T's crossed, but emotionally, neither of us really feels the need for it.
author: Evangeline Lilly

text: A new command I give you: Love one another. As I have loved you, so you must love one another.
author: Jesus Christ

text: Grief is in two parts. The first is loss. The second is the remaking of life.
author: Anne Roiphe

text: America's freedom of religion, and freedom from religion, offers every wisdom tradition an opportunity to address our soul-deep needs: Christianity, Judaism, Islam, Buddhism, Hinduism, secular humanism, agnosticism and atheism among others.
author: Parker Palmer

text: I mean, I'm very serious with my kids about them comprehending the intricacies of global finance.
author: Will Smith

text: Every good citizen makes his country's honor his own, and cherishes it not only as precious but as sacred. He is willing to risk his life in its defense and is conscious that he gains protection while he gives it.
author: Andrew Jackson

text: I was in kidney failure. I ended up having a kidney transplant on my 21st birthday.
author: Amy Purdy

text: May you live as long as you wish and love as long as you live.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

text: My message to the people and rulers of Pakistan is, 'As neighbours, we want peace and friendship and cooperation with you so that together we can change the face of South Asia.'
author: Atal Bihari Vajpayee

text: The Universal Zulu Nation stands to acknowledge wisdom, understanding, freedom, justice, and equality, peace, unity, love, and having fun, work, overcoming the negative through the positive, science, mathematics, faith, facts, and the wonders of God, whether we call him Allah, Jehovah, Yahweh, or Jah.
author: Afrika Bambaataa

text: The biggest direct influence on my career is Ben Edlund, who gave me my first real professional break and, through his friendship and example, turned me into a writer and a more critical thinker in general.
author: Christopher McCulloch

text: One of the reasons people stop learning is that they become less and less willing to risk failure.
author: John W. Gardner

text: People say history is boring, and that is true because people are boring. We haven't changed since time began. We're still the same. We've obviously made some changes. When we started, it was all about food, clothing and shelter. Now we watch 'Top Chef', 'Project Runway', and 'Extreme Makeover: Home Edition.'
author: Colin Hay

text: I like guitar. It just turned out that it's the instrument I learned to play. I have a lot of respect for it, and I'm learning more and more every day. For me, the classic band setup - guitars, drums, bass - will stay fresh forever. I don't know. I'm still into it.
author: Mac DeMarco

text: Why should anybody be interested in some old man who was a failure?
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: Marriage is good enough for the lower classes: they have facilities for desertion that are denied to us.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Success is an absurd, erratic thing. She arrives when one least expects her and after she has come may depart again almost because of a whim.
author: Alice Foote MacDougall

text: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.
author: Samuel Butler

text: Furthermore I will just have to see what the future will bring me. But a change of food whets the appetite.
author: Jonathan Brandis

text: Love conquers all.
author: Virgil

text: Friendship is inexplicable, it should not be explained if one doesn't want to kill it.
author: Max Jacob

text: I think togetherness is a very important ingredient to family life.
author: Barbara Bush

text: Spain is finding it very difficult to finance itself with sovereign debt risk premium so high.
author: Mariano Rajoy

text: Basically, I still have the privacy that all celebrities crave, except for those celebrities who feel that privacy reflects some kind of failure on their part.
author: Albert Brooks

text: God has already done everything He's going to do. The ball is now in your court. If you want success, if you want wisdom, if you want to be prosperous and healthy, you're going to have to do more than meditate and believe; you must boldly declare words of faith and victory over yourself and your family.
author: Joel Osteen

text: A life is not important except in the impact it has on other lives.
author: Jackie Robinson

text: I do not think that there is any other quality so essential to success of any kind as the quality of perseverance. It overcomes almost everything, even nature.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: With every book, you go back to school. You become a student. You become an investigative reporter. You spend a little time learning what it's like to live in someone else's shoes.
author: John Irving

text: TV started for me just as a means of keeping my husband Desi off the road. He'd been on tour with his band since he got out of the Army, and we were in our 11th year of marriage and wanted to have children.
author: Lucille Ball

text: The first thing to be said about 'Prague Winter,' former Secretary of State Madeleine Albright's new book, is that she very wisely chooses to confront early on in it her apparent surprise at learning late in life that she was born Jewish.
author: Michael Korda

text: Stop using the word 'bromance.' Can we please kill that stupid term? We're just friends. It's called friendship!
author: Blake Shelton

text: Trouble shared is trouble halved.
author: Lee Iacocca

text: Life isn't fair. It's true, and you still have to deal with it. Whining about it rarely levels the playing field, but learning to rise above it is the ultimate reward.
author: Harvey Mackay

text: I realized that I was afraid to really, really try something, 100%, because I had never reached true failure.
author: Trent Reznor

text: The Divine of the Lord in heaven is love, for the reason that love is receptive of all things of heaven, such as peace, intelligence, wisdom and happiness.
author: Emanuel Swedenborg

text: If I were given the opportunity to present a gift to the next generation, it would be the ability for each individual to learn to laugh at himself.
author: Charles M. Schulz

text: A loving heart is the beginning of all knowledge.
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: Children love and want to be loved and they very much prefer the joy of accomplishment to the triumph of hateful failure. Do not mistake a child for his symptom.
author: Erik Erikson

text: When I exercise, I like to take lots of different classes because I want to really apply myself and feel like I'm learning a new skill. Not that I ever want to have to demonstrate any of those skills!
author: Zooey Deschanel

text: Don't flatter yourselves that friendship authorizes you to say disagreeable things to your intimates. On the contrary, the nearer you come into relation with a person, the more necessary do tact and courtesy become.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

text: My life is about ups and downs, great joys and great losses.
author: Isabel Allende

text: Wars and elections are both too big and too small to matter in the long run. The daily work - that goes on, it adds up.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

text: Coming to terms with the fact that my marriage was a failure was devastating and very difficult.
author: Sarah McLachlan

text: Learning and innovation go hand in hand. The arrogance of success is to think that what you did yesterday will be sufficient for tomorrow.
author: William Pollard

text: Every marriage is a mystery to me, even the one I'm in. So I'm no expert on it.
author: Hillary Clinton

text: We at Chrysler borrow money the old-fashioned way. We pay it back.
author: Lee Iacocca

text: About the only problem with success is that it does not teach you how to deal with failure.
author: Tommy Lasorda

text: Now you can get artisanal everything - pickles, coffees, house-cured meats, mustard. The pendulum has swung back to this kind of food, and it gives me the greatest hope for the future, especially because we're living in a time with issues like polluted Gulf Coast seafood and food labeled organic that may not really be organic.
author: Adam Richman

text: Everyone can relate to love, hurt, pain, learning how to forgive, needing to get over, needing the power of God in their life.
author: Tyler Perry

text: What people actually refer to as research nowadays is really just Googling.
author: Dermot Mulroney

text: I'm passionate about learning. I'm passionate about life.
author: Tom Cruise

text: Success is the only motivational factor that a boy with character needs.
author: Woody Hayes

text: I know my husband really loves me because he takes me to have ribs. He says I'm the only girl he ever took out who actually ate anything on her plate, as opposed to pushing it around.
author: Julia Barr

text: In the long run, with profits from piracy greater than international finance mobilised to solve the problem, we can expect piracy to increase geographically and in sophistication.
author: Peter Middlebrook

text: Love has no errors, for all errors are the want for love.
author: William Law

text: A person has to remember that the road to success is always under construction. You have to get that through your head. That it is not easy becoming successful.
author: Steve Harvey

text: God's grace is amazing! We're saved by grace - God's undeserved favor - and we live by grace, which is also God's power in our lives to do what we could never do in our own strength. And it's all because God is love, and He loves us unconditionally, constantly and completely.
author: Joyce Meyer

text: Marriage is such a mark of adulthood in my mind.
author: Mandy Moore

text: Learning from the past helps to ensure that mistakes are not repeated.
author: Monica Johnson

text: When service members are discharged, we should express our gratitude for their profound personal sacrifice, not hand them a bill for their hospital food.
author: Barbara Boxer

text: Overhead will eat you alive if not constantly viewed as a parasite to be exterminated. Never mind the bleating of those you employ. Hold out until mutiny is imminent before employing even a single additional member of staff. More startups are wrecked by overstaffing than by any other cause, bar failure to monitor cash flow.
author: Felix Dennis

text: We really are creatures of a violent world, biologically speaking - watching violence and learning about it is one of our cognitive drives.
author: Steven Pinker

text: I've just concluded - since President Obama endorses the same-sex marriage, advocates homosexual people, and enjoys an attractive countenance - thus if it becomes necessary, I shall travel to Washington, D.C., get down on my knee, and ask his hand.
author: Robert Mugabe

text: The comfortable estate of widowhood is the only hope that keeps up a wife's spirits.
author: John Gay

text: Anything will give up its secrets if you love it enough. Not only have I found that when I talk to the little flower or to the little peanut they will give up their secrets, but I have found that when I silently commune with people, they give up their secrets also - if you love them enough.

text: Love is the attempt to form a friendship inspired by beauty.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

text: Life is a journey. When we stop, things don't go right.
author: Pope Francis

text: What I particularly like about Broadway is the camaraderie and the friendship of other people in other shows. Everybody knows you're opening and cares about you. There's a real village atmosphere.
author: Ian Mckellen

text: Our parents deserve our honor and respect for giving us life itself. Beyond this they almost always made countless sacrifices as they cared for and nurtured us through our infancy and childhood, provided us with the necessities of life, and nursed us through physical illnesses and the emotional stresses of growing up.
author: Ezra Taft Benson

text: Sustaining true friendship is a lot more challenging than we give it credit for.
author: Mariella Frostrup

text: Temptation is like a knife, that may either cut the meat or the throat of a man; it may be his food or his poison, his exercise or his destruction.

text: The truest wisdom is a resolute determination.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

text: Learning is finding out what you already know.
author: Richard Bach

text: People are the key to success or extraordinary success.
author: Azim Premji

text: Friendship is the shadow of the evening, which increases with the setting sun of life.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

text: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: No matter how dark the moment, love and hope are always possible.
author: George Chakiris

text: During the days of segregation, there was not a place of higher learning for African Americans. They were simply not welcome in many of the traditional schools. And from this backward policy grew the network of historical black colleges and universities.
author: Michael N. Castle

text: I don't need to go onto Facebook and pretend to have friends I've never even met. To my mind, that kind of destroys the meaning of the word 'friend.' I take exception to that. Because I value and respect friendship.

text: Sweet is the scene where genial friendship plays the pleasing game of interchanging praise.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

text: Only those who have learned the power of sincere and selfless contribution experience life's deepest joy: true fulfillment.
author: Tony Robbins

text: As far as luxury goes, about the only thing I do is... I go first class all the way. I live on the road, so when I'm out there, I'm getting the nice hotel suite, I'm getting the luxury car, I'm eating the good food, and I make sure I take care of myself on the road.
author: Trish Stratus

text: Fear is present when we forget that we are a part of God's divine design. Learning to experience authentic love means abandoning ego's insistence that you have much to fear and that you are in an unfriendly world. You can make the decision to be free from fear and doubt and return to the brilliant light of love that is always with you.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Old age is like everything else. To make a success of it, you've got to start young.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: If it's a good work of adaptation, the book should remain a book and the film should remain a film, and you should not necessarily read the book to see the film. If you do need that, then that means that it's a failure. That is what I think.

text: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
author: Albert Einstein

text: I learned to cook in self-defense. My wife doesn't know what a kitchen is. In the first month of our marriage, she broiled lamb chops 26 nights in a row. Then I took over. I used to mind her not caring about food, but no more - as long as I can eat what I want.
author: Alan King

text: People are more comfortable learning about wine because now they can just Google, you know, 'Soave,' and say, 'Oh, O.K., cool.'
author: Gary Vaynerchuk

text: The Tea Party people say they're angry about socialism, but maybe they're really angry about capitalism. If there's a sense of being looked down upon, it's that sense of failure that's built into a system that assures everyone they can make it to the top, but then reserves the top for only a tiny fraction of the strivers.
author: Gail Collins

text: What sort of job can you hold in America in which it is safe to hold the personal conviction that same-sex marriage is wrong? The answer: there is no such job. Except Democratic presidential candidate in 2008. Then you're fine.

text: What the world really needs is more love and less paper work.
author: Pearl Bailey

text: A happy life is one which is in accordance with its own nature.

text: But friendship is precious, not only in the shade, but in the sunshine of life, and thanks to a benevolent arrangement the greater part of life is sunshine.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Marriage, for a woman at least, hampers the two things that made life to me glorious - friendship and learning.

text: Every failure is a step to success.
author: William Whewell

text: I am not a stickler for Indian food, but by the third day or so I start looking for something familiar to eat. I have travelled a lot, and I always try out local food.

text: The hardest of all is learning to be a well of affection, and not a fountain; to show them we love them not when we feel like it, but when they do.
author: Nan Fairbrother

text: Learning how to learn is the most precious thing we have in life.

text: We learned in World War II that no single nation holds a monopoly on wisdom, morality or right to power, but that we must fight for the weak and promote democracy.

text: I don't think men are that attracted by glamour. I think women are attracted by glamour. I think men are attracted by a sense of friendship.

text: When you fail you learn from the mistakes you made and it motivates you to work even harder.

text: Rich people without wisdom and learning are but sheep with golden fleeces.

text: I have long enjoyed the friendship and companionship of Republicans because I am by instinct a teacher, and I would like to teach them something.

text: The toughest thing about success is that you've got to keep on being a success.

text: I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning how to sail my ship.

text: It doesn't matter whether you are pursuing success in business, sports, the arts, or life in general: The bridge between wishing and accomplishing is discipline.

text: It is the food which you furnish to your mind that determines the whole character of your life.

text: Imagine all the people living life in peace. You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us, and the world will be as one.

text: I am very, very strict with my workout regimen; not so much with my food, because I'm always working out, so I can allow myself to be a bit more naughty!

text: If your current get-rich project fails, take what you learned and try something else. Keep repeating until something lucky happens. The universe has plenty of luck to go around; you just need to keep your hand raised until it's your turn. It helps to see failure as a road and not a wall.

text: To want friendship is a great fault. Friendship ought to be a gratuitous joy, like the joys afforded by art or life.

text: In a deeply tribal sense, we love our monsters, and I think that is the key to it right there. It is monsters; it is learning about them: it is both thrill and safety. author: Peter Benchley

text: Nothing brings me more happiness than trying to help the most vulnerable people in society. It is a goal and an essential part of my life - a kind of destiny. Whoever is in distress can call on me. I will come running wherever they are.

text: Every decision we make - when we choose a vehicle, when we pump gas into that vehicle, when we order food - is not just a personal lifestyle choice. It's an environmental and moral choice.

text: When you dance together, there's a fabulous interaction. It's quite intimate. You're touching your partner, leading them. Learning how to behave in that person's proximity is a skill. I love it. I can't imagine tiring of it.

text: Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside us while we live.

text: Qualities you need to get through medical school and residency: Discipline. Patience. Perseverance. A willingness to forgo sleep. A penchant for sadomasochism. Ability to weather crises of faith and self-confidence. Accept exhaustion as fact of life. Addiction to caffeine a definite plus. Unfailing optimism that the end is in sight.

text: It's a European Union of economic failure, of mass unemployment and of low growth.

text: Follow your passion. Nothing - not wealth, success, accolades or fame - is worth spending a lifetime doing things you don't enjoy.

text: Once you label me you negate me.

text: Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer.

text: Past success is no guarantee of future success, so I have learned to be an entrepreneur. I began to produce and direct my own projects.

text: During my undergraduate training at UCLA, I was studying finance and securities; my particular interest was with mutual funds. Wanting to get into a high position at some of the companies that were doing that, I knew that law would be useful.

text: The consequence of the Bay of Pigs failure wasn't an acceptance of Castro and his control of Cuba but, rather, a renewed determination to bring him down by stealth.

text: Think little goals and expect little achievements. Think big goals and win big success.

text: A man reserves his true and deepest love not for the species of woman in whose company he finds himself electrified and enkindled, but for that one in whose company he may feel tenderly drowsy.

text: In 'Citizens United v. FEC', the Supreme Court ruled that sections of the federal campaign finance law known as McCain-Feingold imposed unconstitutional restrictions on the First Amendment rights of corporations.

text: An unschooled man who knows how to meditate upon the Lord has learned far more than the man with the highest education who does not know how to meditate.

text: I believe that the essence of marriage is choosing someone who loves you for who you are, embraces everything about you, and building a life with that person. Whether that life is with children or without children - it's honestly immaterial to building a life with someone that you love fully.

text: You and I come by road or rail, but economists travel on infrastructure.

text: Keep it simple in the kitchen. If you use quality ingredients, you don't need anything fancy to make food delicious: just a knife, a cutting board, and some good nonstick cookware, and you're set.

text: I don't really consider myself to be a personal finance expert compared with some others. There are quite a few that know a lot more than I do.

text: The purpose of a moral philosophy is not to look delightfully strange and counterintuitive or to provide employment to bioethicists. The purpose is to guide our choices toward life, health, beauty, happiness, fun, laughter, challenge, and learning.

text: What we now call 'finance' is, I hold, an intellectual perversion of what began as warm human love.

text: I always want to be a messenger, a person that, you know, that's not afraid to pass on wisdom.

text: Of course I believe in love despite four divorces. There is nobody who doesn't believe in love. But marriage - that fits some people but obviously not me.

text: Start with God - the first step in learning is bowing down to God; only fools thumb their noses at such wisdom and learning.

text: I spent a college semester in a small town in Italy - and that is where I truly tasted food for the first time.

text: Lead yourself whenever your boss' leadership deteriorates. When your boss doesn't praise what you do, praise yourself. When your boss doesn't make you big, make yourself big. Remember, if you have done your best, failure does not count.

text: I find writing very difficult. It's hard and it hurts sometimes, and it's scary because of the fear of failure and the very unpleasant feeling that you may have reached the limit of your abilities.

text: Sometimes we never see what failure is and often fail to recognize it.

text: Being human means you will make mistakes. And you will make mistakes, because failure is God's way of moving you in another direction.

text: When life is too easy for us, we must beware or we may not be ready to meet the blows which sooner or later come to everyone, rich or poor.

text: Daddy was real gentle with kids. That's why I expected so much out of marriage, figuring that all men should be steady and pleasant.

text: Character develops itself in the stream of life.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Whether or not Americans supported George W. Bush, they could not avoid learning about Abu Ghraib.

text: I had more energy at 50. On the other hand, at 75, I've probably got a little more wisdom and good judgment than I had at 50 because I've got more experience. But I haven't really changed. I'm still driven by the same philosophy.

text: Was President Obama's endorsement of gay marriage crassly political? God, I hope so.
author: Timothy Noah

text: One could surely argue that the Buddhist tradition, taken as a whole, represents the richest source of contemplative wisdom that any civilization has produced.

text: If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?
author: Albert Einstein

text: Love is a mutual self-giving which ends in self-recovery.
author: Fulton J. Sheen

text: In reality, I am more a professor, one who reflects and mediates on spiritual questions. Practical governance is not my strong point, and this is certainly a weakness. But I do not see myself as a failure. For eight years, I carried out my work.
author: Pope Benedict XVI

text: I support gay marriage. I believe they have a right to be as miserable as the rest of us.
author: Kinky Friedman

text: Social enables word of mouth at an unprecedented scale. Its most powerful effect, through reviews and recommendations, is to put product quality and value for money as the key to success in commerce. Social brings a level of transparency that prevents marketers from advertising their way to success without underlying product quality.
author: Roelof Botha

text: More power than all the success slogans ever penned by human hand is the realization for every man that he has but one boss. That boss is the man - he - himself.
author: Gabriel Heatter

text: If you have the opportunity to play this game of life you need to appreciate every moment. a lot of people don't appreciate the moment until it's passed.

text: Nature is a dream state at this point, that we almost don't have a real relationship to it unless it's people living off the land and killing our own food and going for it.
author: Catherine Opie

text: You know, Republicans should have a consistent philosophy. And if your philosophy is about limited government and not intruding in people's lives, you shouldn't just inconveniently take a social issue like gay marriage and say, 'Well, unless we think - actually we should be intruding your life.'
author: Mark McKinnon

text: Of course, Third World leaders love you. By ascribing third world ills to First World sins, you absolve them of blame for their countries' failure to advance.
author: John McCarthy

text: I'm calling my book series the 'with God series.' And this next 'with God' book is Friendship with God, which comes out in November. This books challenges us to bring about the end of 'better' on this planet.

text: Success is knowing that your contribution is what helps the collective.
author: Adrian Grenier

text: I have never denied my background or my culture. I have taught my child to embrace her Mexican heritage, to love my first language, Spanish, to learn about Mexican history, music, folk art, food, and even the Mexican candy I grew up with.

text: Perhaps my problem in marriage - and it is the problem of many women - was to want both intimacy and independence. It is a difficult line to walk, yet both needs are important to a marriage.

text: I'm forever learning and that's why I'm always able to create new styles and new dimensions of hip-hop.
author: Doug E. Fresh

text: In terms of my involvement in 'don't ask, don't tell' and marriage equality and anti-bullying and social emotional learning in schools - these are all things that arise out of my relationship with the world and with my fans.
author: Lady Gaga

text: Wall Street has too much wealth and political power.
author: Charlie Munger

text: I think my whole life, because of where I came from, I had a fear of failure.
author: Howard Schultz

text: The way I see it, love is an amusement park, and food its souvenir.
author: Stephanie Klein

text: Love is like a friendship caught on fire. In the beginning a flame, very pretty, often hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. As love grows older, our hearts mature and our love becomes as coals, deep-burning and unquenchable.
author: Bruce Lee

text: When we meet real tragedy in life, we can react in two ways - either by losing hope and falling into self-destructive habits, or by using the challenge to find our inner strength. Thanks to the teachings of Buddha, I have been able to take this second way.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Often the magical elements in my books are standing in for elements of the real world, the small and magical-in-their-own-right sorts of things that we take for granted and no longer pay attention to, like the bonds of friendship that entwine our own lives with those of other people and places.
author: Charles de Lint

text: I don't eat fast food, but I can't live without pizza.
author: Trevor Donovan

text: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
author: Euripides

text: A traveller must buy his own experience, and success or failure depends mainly on personal idiosyncrasies.
author: Isabella Bird

text: I'm now the elder in the position of doling out wisdom and trying to mend fences.
author: Jane Fonda

text: This is love: to fly toward a secret sky, to cause a hundred veils to fall each moment. First to let go of life. Finally, to take a step without feet.
author: Rumi

text: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make us entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.
author: Epicurus

text: About the time we can make the ends meet, somebody moves the ends.
author: Herbert Hoover

text: The secret of success in every field is redefining what success means to you. It can't be your parent's definition, the media's definition, or your neighbor's definition. Otherwise, success will never satisfy you.
author: RuPaul

text: There is a scarcity of friendship, but not of friends.
author: Thomas Fuller

text: No party has a monopoly on wisdom. No democracy works without compromise. But when Governor Romney and his allies in Congress tell us we can somehow lower our deficit by spending trillions more on new tax breaks for the wealthy - well, you do the math. I refuse to go along with that. And as long as I'm President, I never will.
author: Barack Obama

text: It's impossible for a Democrat to be a failure. It's impossible for a Democrat to be a reprobate. It's impossible for a Democrat to be a mess. It just isn't possible, as far as the mind-set of the media is concerned.
author: Rush Limbaugh

text: I was never against marriage per se. Before feminism, I didn't think you had any choice. In fact, for a long time I always assumed I would get married. I just didn't see any marriages I wanted to emulate, so I kept putting it off.
author: Gloria Steinem

text: There would be no need for love if perfection were possible. Love arises from our imperfection, from our being different and always in need of the forgiveness, encouragement and that missing half of ourselves that we are searching for, as the Greek myth tells us, in order to complete ourselves.
author: Eugene Kennedy

text: Though lovers be lost, love shall not.
author: Dylan Thomas

text: I'm learning all the time. I'm evolving all the time as a human being. I'm getting better, I hope, in all of the important ways.
author: Neil Peart

text: When we looked at the life cycle in our 40s, we looked to old people for wisdom. At 80, though, we look at other 80-year-olds to see who got wise and who not. Lots of old people don't get wise, but you don't get wise unless you age.
author: Erik Erikson

text: Friends are the best to turn to when you're having a rough day.
author: Justin Bieber

text: It will give them the opportunity to show themselves worthy of the respect and friendship of peace-loving nations, and in time, to take an honorable place among members of the United Nations.
author: James F. Byrnes

text: Love isn't something you find. Love is something that finds you.
author: Loretta Young

text: Life is a game and true love is a trophy.
author: Rufus Wainwright

text: There's always failure. And there's always disappointment. And there's always loss. But the secret is learning from the loss, and realizing that none of those holes are vacuums.
author: Michael J. Fox

text: 'Tis love that makes the world go round, my baby.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Pregnant women who are in places where Zika is spreading should do everything they can to avoid mosquito bites. And we, as a society, need to do everything we can to control Zika. That means learning more about it; that means controlling mosquitoes more effectively. That means achieving a vaccine.
author: Tom Frieden

text: I don't turn to greeting cards for wisdom and advice, but they are a fine reflection of the general drift of the culture.
author: Susan Orlean

text: At the beginning of the new century, it is the common aspiration of the peoples of the two countries to deepen mutual understanding, enhance trust, develop friendship and strengthen cooperation.
author: Li Peng

text: The path from dreams to success does exist. May you have the vision to find it, the courage to get on to it, and the perseverance to follow it.
author: Kalpana Chawla

text: We should regret our mistakes and learn from them, but never carry them forward into the future with us.
author: Lucy Maud Montgomery

text: I feel it is an obligation to help people understand the relation of food to agriculture and the relationship of food to culture.
author: Alice Waters

text: Food and love are all intertwined at our core level. It can be a very nurturing, wonderful, loving thing.
author: Jami Attenberg

text: Most vegetarians look so much like the food they eat that they can be classified as cannibals.
author: Finley Peter Dunne

text: There are people out there who hate me and who say I'm arrogant, vain, and whatever. That's all part of my success. I am made to be the best.
author: Cristiano Ronaldo

text: Learning to live for others isn't something that just comes naturally to anybody. You have to train yourself to do it.
author: Joyce Meyer

text: Failure is a word unknown to me.
author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah

text: With everything that is complex, we learn. If you don't learn, then it's an utter and abject failure. If you do learn, and you're able to apply that to the next situation, then you take away a measure of success.
author: Ben Carson

text: I sort of understood that when I first started: that you shouldn't repeat a success. Very often you're going to, and maybe the first time you do, it works. And you love it. But then you're trapped.

text: Some wisdom you must learn from one who's wise.
author: Euripides

text: Like everything which is not the involuntary result of fleeting emotion but the creation of time and will, any marriage, happy or unhappy, is infinitely more interesting than any romance, however passionate.
author: W. H. Auden

text: Our happiness depends on wisdom all the way.
author: Sophocles

text: The difference between chirping out of turn and a faux pas depends on what kind of a bar you're in.
author: Wilson Mizner

text: Communism is not love. Communism is a hammer which we use to crush the enemy.
author: Mao Zedong

text: The whole notion of pain, and how every individual experiences pain, is up for debate. We don't know how another person experiences pain - physical pain or psychic pain. Some of these clinics where assisted suicide or euthanasia is practiced, they call it 'weariness of life.'
author: Miriam Toews

text: For small creatures such as we the vastness is bearable only through love.
author: Carl Sagan

text: Ironically, when I was in Dubai with the BBC 'Good Food Show,' even though it's an urban area, when you see the vast panorama from the top of the Burj Khalifa, it feels remote, as if it's just sprung up out of the desert. I like Dubai. I didn't think I would, but the food and the people were great.
author: Paul Hollywood

text: I constantly experience failure in that my work is never as good as I want it to be. So I live with failure.
author: Jeremy Irons

text: When people say 'marriage' to me... It's always a means to an end. Everyone's so in a rush to define the relationship.
author: Lady Gaga

text: There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist, or accept the responsibility for changing them.
author: Denis Waitley

text: Love is a hole in the heart.
author: Ben Hecht

text: Success makes men rigid and they tend to exalt stability over all the other virtues; tired of the effort of willing they become fanatics about conservatism.
author: Walter Lippmann

text: You can't have any successes unless you can accept failure.
author: George Cukor

text: When a film is successful, you don't need to shout about it from the rooftops. I don't believe in going into overdrive. There's no desperation to be acknowledged as the reason for a film's success.
author: Emraan Hashmi

text: College gives people learning and also takes away future opportunities by loading the next generation down with debt.
author: Peter Thiel

text: Acceptable food rots while we are chased from bins behind restaurants, chased from sleeping on the street, chased from relieving ourselves unless we pay for food or gas, until finally we are so hungry, sleepless, smelly, constipated and beaten-down that we simply die of lack of will to live.
author: Jane Siberry

text: Puppet camp truly redefined my preconceptions of puppetry... I'll never forget learning that before a puppet can speak... he has to inhale. It's those details that make the characters truly come to life.
author: Rob McClure

text: Virtue comes by nature, learning, and practice, and thanks to virtue, all of the aforesaid may deserve approval.
author: Apollonius of Tyana

text: In youth and beauty, wisdom is but rare!
author: Homer

text: You don't lose weight by watching someone else exercise. You don't learn by watching someone else solve problems. It became clear to me that the only way to do online learning effectively is to have students solve problems.
author: Sebastian Thrun

text: People think your success is just a matter of having a pretty face. But it's easy to be chewed up and spat out. You've got to stay ahead of the game to be able to stay in it.
author: Kate Moss

text: The very nature of finance is that it cannot be profitable unless it is significantly leveraged... and as long as there is debt, there can be failure and contagion.
author: Alan Greenspan

text: Love is a smoke made with the fume of sighs.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Every day is a new opportunity. You can build on yesterday's success or put its failures behind and start over again. That's the way life is, with a new game every day, and that's the way baseball is.
author: Bob Feller

text: I realized that everything I had to do I could not do on my own, and so I was almost obliged to put myself in God's hands, to trust in Jesus who - while I wrote my book on him - I felt bound to by an old and more profound friendship.
author: Pope Benedict XVI

text: I'm getting to a point where everything is becoming streamlined in my life. I'm learning how to stand onstage for two hours and play in front of thousands of people as if I am completely in the moment every moment.
author: John Mayer

text: Food brings people together on many different levels. It's nourishment of the soul and body; it's truly love.
author: Giada De Laurentiis

text: God proved His love on the Cross. When Christ hung, and bled, and died, it was God saying to the world, 'I love you.'
author: Billy Graham

text: All married couples should learn the art of battle as they should learn the art of making love. Good battle is objective and honest - never vicious or cruel. Good battle is healthy and constructive, and brings to a marriage the principles of equal partnership.
author: Ann Landers

text: And we want to develop our strategy to partnership and friendship with the United States, which is connected with a very rich history but what is very important for our future.
author: Aleksander Kwasniewski

text: I'm learning with my mom how to cook more Spanish food. I'm trying to make a good paella, but that's a real art.
author: Daniel Bruhl

text: You can give without loving, but you can never love without giving.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: Every kid has a toy that they believe is their best friend, that they believe communicates with them, and they imagine it being alive, their toy horse or car or whatever it is. Stop-motion is the only medium where we literally can make a toy come to life, an actual object.
author: Henry Selick

text: I was adored once too.
author: William Shakespeare

text: There are a lot of things that go into creating success. I don't like to do just the things I like to do. I like to do things that cause the company to succeed. I don't spend a lot of time doing my favorite activities.
author: Michael Dell

text: How marriage ruins a man! It is as demoralizing as cigarettes, and far more expensive.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: To have success in your professional life is not so hard. To succeed as a man is more difficult.
author: Yann Arthus-Bertrand

text: Friendship without self-interest is one of the rare and beautiful things of life.
author: James F. Byrnes
