text: Don't taunt the alligator until after you've crossed the creek.
author: Dan Rather

text: Life excites me-just little, normal, everyday things. Getting out of bed. Getting dressed. Making food. I find it all exciting.
author: Liv Tyler

text: Marriage is a wonderful institution, but who wants to live in an institution?
author: Groucho Marx

text: I wasn't a financial pro, and I paid the price.
author: Ruth Handler

text: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

text: We have a saying in the Marine Corps and that is 'no better friend, no worse enemy, than a U.S. Marine.' We always hope for the first, friendship, but are certainly more than ready for the second.
author: John F. Kelly

text: I rise today in support of Bill C-38, the Civil Marriage Act. I rise in support of a Canada in which liberties are safeguarded, rights are protected and the people of this land are treated as equals under the law.
author: Paul Martin

text: The paradigm of the 'Aquarian Conspiracy' sees humankind embedded in nature. It promotes the autonomous individual in a decentralized society... The new perspective respects the ecology of everything: birth, death, learning, health, family, work, science, spirituality, the arts, the community, relationships, politics.
author: Marilyn Ferguson

text: Success is just being happy. And I try so many different things. I do a lot of different things. Because I think God has helped me to love myself. I know who God is, and I love God.
author: Herschel Walker

text: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

text: The very phrase 'Oscar night' used to accelerate my pulse. For one thing - dating myself - it meant Bob Hope. He always had good, strong jokes, that faultless delivery, and always a new joke about his own films' failure - once again - to be honored.
author: Dick Cavett

text: Wise kings generally have wise counselors; and he must be a wise man himself who is capable of distinguishing one.
author: Diogenes

text: Being in love with somebody is a wonderful feeling.
author: Shane Warne

text: When you grow up close to poultry and fields and gardens and open-air markets, you can't help but develop an instinct for quality food.
author: Alain Ducasse

text: I planned my success. I knew it was going to happen.
author: Erykah Badu

text: Pasta is the one food I can't live without. It's the food I eat to fuel my running.
author: Joe Bastianich

text: Good planning is important. I've also regarded a sense of humor as one of the most important things on a big expedition. When you're in a difficult or dangerous situation, or when you're depressed about the chances of success, someone who can make you laugh eases the tension.
author: Edmund Hillary

text: Success is about honour, feeling morally calibrated, absence of shame, not what some newspaper defines from an external metric.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: Socialism is a philosophy of failure, the creed of ignorance, and the gospel of envy, its inherent virtue is the equal sharing of misery.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Marriage is about the most expensive way for the average man to get laundry done.
author: Burt Reynolds

text: I'd think learning to play the guitar would be very confusing for sighted people.
author: Doc Watson

text: To be wholly devoted to some intellectual exercise is to have succeeded in life.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: It means a lot to me, the sanctity of marriage.
author: Darlene Love

text: Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.
author: Joan Rivers

text: The fate of love is that it always seems too little or too much.
author: Amelia Barr

text: It is paradoxical that many educators and parents still differentiate between a time for learning and a time for play without seeing the vital connection between them.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: Our scientific age demands that we provide definitions, measurements, and statistics in order to be taken seriously. Yet most of the important things in life cannot be precisely defined or measured. Can we define or measure love, beauty, friendship, or decency, for example?
author: Dennis Prager

text: Have you learned the lessons only of those who admired you, and were tender with you, and stood aside for you? Have you not learned great lessons from those who braced themselves against you, and disputed passage with you?
author: Walt Whitman

text: I was born to be married. I just feel comfortable there. I love the idea of being partnered for ever. I love my girlfriend, we've been best friends since I was 18. There's not a thing we haven't been through except for marriage... We've had talks about what we would name our kids since we were in our 20s.
author: Beth Ditto

text: Finance is critical. If sufficient investment is made in infrastructure and venture capital is made available, there will be a big improvement in the situation.
author: Sanjay Kumar

text: Cooking is one of the strongest ceremonies for life. When recipes are put together, the kitchen is a chemical laboratory involving air, fire, water and the earth. This is what gives value to humans and elevates their spiritual qualities. If you take a frozen box and stick it in the microwave, you become connected to the factory.
author: Laura Esquivel

text: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: When you hear the word 'disabled,' people immediately think about people who can't walk or talk or do everything that people take for granted. Now, I take nothing for granted. But I find the real disability is people who can't find joy in life and are bitter.
author: Teri Garr

text: The feeling of friendship is like that of being comfortably filled with roast beef; love, like being enlivened with champagne.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: Life is nothing but a bunch of experiences. There's no such thing as success or failure.
author: Suki Waterhouse

text: I love to take something ordinary and make it really special.
author: Ina Garten

text: I cannot give you the formula for success, but I can give you the formula for failure - which is: Try to please everybody.
author: Herbert Bayard Swope

text: Our deeds determine us, as much as we determine our deeds.
author: George Eliot

text: There is no failure except in no longer trying.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: At home I serve the kind of food I know the story behind.
author: Michael Pollan

text: I think we are evolving rapidly into one world culture. It's certainly one world economy. With billions of people online, I think we'll appreciate the wisdom in many different traditions as we learn more about them. People were very isolated and didn't know anything about other religions 100 years ago.
author: Ray Kurzweil

text: My great fear has always been complete and utter failure. Hence, you see, all the dispossessed people in my fiction, and why I try to earn as much money as I can. It's a defense. I don't enjoy it or do anything with it.
author: Peter Ackroyd

text: Chicken and horse meat are the best foods for weightlifters, and good food is important.
author: Ilya Ilyin

text: Experience is making mistakes and learning from them.
author: Bill Ackman

text: I am a misanthrope and yet utterly benevolent, have more than one screw loose yet am a super-idealist who digests philosophy more efficiently than food.
author: Alfred Nobel

text: I'm the only man in the world with a marriage licence made out to whom it may concern.
author: Mickey Rooney

text: Love can sometimes be magic. But magic can sometimes... just be an illusion.
author: Javan

text: Poverty is relative, and the lack of food and of the necessities of life is not necessarily a hardship. Spiritual and social ostracism, the invasion of your privacy, are what constitute the pain of poverty.
author: Alice Foote MacDougall

text: Mistakes are the portals of discovery.
author: James Joyce

text: Learn to enjoy every minute of your life. Be happy now. Don't wait for something outside of yourself to make you happy in the future. Think how really precious is the time you have to spend, whether it's at work or with your family. Every minute should be enjoyed and savored.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: The press is just not your friend when it comes to a marriage. That's why we didn't sell the pictures of our wedding, and we got offered millions of dollars for them, millions.
author: Katy Perry

text: Achievement of your happiness is the only moral purpose of your life, and that happiness, not pain or mindless self-indulgence, is the proof of your moral integrity, since it is the proof and the result of your loyalty to the achievement of your values.
author: Ayn Rand

text: I thank my God for graciously granting me the opportunity of learning that death is the key which unlocks the door to our true happiness.
author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

text: Have you ever heard of a good marriage growing in front of the cameras?
author: Brigitte Bardot

text: Success represents the 1% of your work which results from the 99% that is called failure.
author: Soichiro Honda

text: You can observe a lot by watching.
author: Yogi Berra

text: If suffering brings wisdom, I would wish to be less wise.
author: William Butler Yeats

text: When I started, you had cochineal food colouring that would turn things pink, but you could never make it red. Now, red is no problem - and if you look at supermarket bakery sections since 'Bake Off' began, you can get everything.
author: Mary Berry

text: If women will not accept marriage with subjection, nor men proffer it without, there is, there can be, no alternative. The women who will not be ruled must live without marriage. And during this transition period... single women make comfortable and attractive homes for themselves.
author: Susan B. Anthony

text: Management is efficiency in climbing the ladder of success; leadership determines whether the ladder is leaning against the right wall.
author: Stephen Covey

text: It is incredibly important to set goals for your business, as if you have no direction for your business, your online business will be a failure.
author: Fabrizio Moreira

text: We should triple the amount we spend on defense and quadruple what we spend on prisons. Why do we pay for food stamps? Welfare? Medicare? They don't keep us safe. If anything, they nurture the most dangerous elements of society.
author: Tom Cotton

text: The superior man makes the difficulty to be overcome his first interest; success only comes later.
author: Confucius

text: He whose wisdom cannot help him, gets no good from being wise.
author: Quintus Ennius

text: Don't walk in front of me, I may not follow. Don't walk behind me, I may not lead. There is only one happiness in life, to love and be loved.
author: George Sand

text: Anybody who succeeds is helping people. The secret to success is find a need and fill it; find a hurt and heal it; find a problem and solve it.
author: Robert H. Schuller

text: True love stories never have endings.
author: Richard Bach

text: Purity engenders Wisdom, Passion avarice, and Ignorance folly, infatuation and darkness.
author: Cyril Connolly

text: To love is to admire with the heart; to admire is to love with the mind.
author: Theophile Gautier

text: What makes the food that we do at Alinea so interesting on the outside is that we really don't let ourselves say no to an idea.
author: Grant Achatz

text: I guess I'm a good manager now. Moreover, I'm loving the concept of donning the producer's hat. It's all very exciting as well as a great learning experience. You're a part of a film right from its conception to its execution, and that's an amazing feeling.
author: Malaika Arora Khan

text: The thing is, when I had my first success it did coincide with the end of my first marriage, and because I went on to have a very, very unhappy two years, I don't think I equate career success with personal happiness.
author: Rob Brydon

text: I want to build a legacy at the WWE, but I definitely want to continue to grow the Bella Empire. I want it to go beyond the ring. I would love to be a motivational speaker.
author: Nikki Bella

text: The secret of a happy marriage is finding the right person. You know they're right if you love to be with them all the time.
author: Julia Child

text: I don't think there's going to be a day when I don't think about food or my body, but I'm living with it, and I wish I could tell young girls to find their safe place and stay with it.
author: Demi Lovato

text: I just love Chinese food. My favourite dish is number 27.
author: Clement Attlee

text: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.
author: Phyllis Theroux

text: The most exhausting thing in life is being insincere.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

text: A lot of the problems I had with fame I was bringing on myself. A lot of self-loathing, a lot of woe-is-me. Now I'm learning to see the positive side of things, instead of, like, 'I can't go to Kmart. I can't take my kids to the haunted house.'
author: Eminem

text: He who knows no hardships will know no hardihood. He who faces no calamity will need no courage. Mysterious though it is, the characteristics in human nature which we love best grow in a soil with a strong mixture of troubles.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

text: When I first went to Paris in 1965, I fell in love with the small, family-owned restaurants that existed everywhere then, as well as the markets and the French obsession with buying fresh food, often twice a day.
author: Alice Waters

text: I saw as a teacher how, if you take that spark of learning that those children have, and you ignite it, you can take a child from any background to a lifetime of creativity and accomplishment.
author: Paul Wellstone

text: We are all responsible to Jesus first, and then, under him, to various other persons and offices. Discerning the path of love and obedience when two or more of these submissive relationships collide is a call to humble, Bible-saturated, spiritual wisdom.
author: John Piper

text: I love the beach. I love the sea. All my life I live within - in front of the sea.
author: Rafael Nadal

text: Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world.
author: Archimedes

text: As to marriage or celibacy, let a man take which course he will, he will be sure to repent.
author: Socrates

text: The journey that I have undertaken, meeting people from all walks of life and learning from them, has been my biggest achievement.
author: Aamir Khan

text: In the long term, Germany didn't need a finance minister who was absent during important negotiations in the European Council. But the chancellor strongly encouraged me to stay. And everything did work out for the best in the end.
author: Wolfgang Schauble

text: It's okay to fail 'cause there's no failure, you're just informing the richness of your experience, and that's - that's the greatest gift you can possibly give yourself.
author: Ben Foster

text: Why does man kill? He kills for food. And not only food: frequently there must be a beverage.
author: Woody Allen

text: In some parts of the world, students are going to school every day. It's their normal life. But in other part of the world, we are starving for education... it's like a precious gift. It's like a diamond.
author: Malala Yousafzai

text: I say to my children, the reason that marriage - and having children - is so important is that it stops you thinking about yourself. The way to happiness is to give yourself to others and to think of others before you think of yourself.
author: Terry Wogan

text: A happy wife is a happy life.
author: Gavin Rossdale

text: I don't know how it is for women or for other guys, but when I was young and in my 20s, I had a fear of marriage.
author: Jeff Bridges

text: Being stylish is about enjoying your life and expressing yourself and your inner light.
author: Tori Amos

text: No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow.
author: Alice Walker

text: The secret to a happy marriage is if you can be at peace with someone within four walls, if you are content because the one you love is near to you, either upstairs or downstairs, or in the same room, and you feel that warmth that you don't find very often, then that is what love is all about.
author: Bruce Forsyth

text: Everybody understands friendship, and friendship is different than love - it's a different kind of love. Friendship has more freedom, more latitude. You don't expect your friend to be as you think your friend should be; you expect your friend just to love you as a friend.
author: Carole King

text: It's your own fear of failure that stops you from doing things.
author: Anupam Kher

text: Joy is prayer; joy is strength: joy is love; joy is a net of love by which you can catch souls.
author: Mother Teresa

text: All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence, and then success is sure.
author: Mark Twain

text: Learning is not compulsory... neither is survival.
author: W. Edwards Deming

text: Just as treasures are uncovered from the earth, so virtue appears from good deeds, and wisdom appears from a pure and peaceful mind. To walk safely through the maze of human life, one needs the light of wisdom and the guidance of virtue.
author: Buddha

text: You can't improve what you can't measure, and liberals have resisted any kind of meaningful measurement of success in the classroom for decades. Instead of focusing on the three R's, liberals have thrown up a barrage of silly things designed to distract us all from their awful stewardship of the schools.
author: Mike Gallagher

text: Whether you come from a council estate or a country estate, your success will be determined by your own confidence and fortitude.
author: Michelle Obama

text: Just as treasures are uncovered from the earth, so virtue appears from good deeds, and wisdom appears from a pure and peaceful mind. To walk safely through the maze of human life, one needs the light of wisdom and the guidance of virtue.
author: Buddha

text: I'm a girl who loves fashion. I'm such a Cinderella - I love to put on a great dress and heels. It's fun!
author: Maria Bello

text: You don't want to have so much money going toward your mortgage every month that you can't enjoy life or take care of your other financial responsibilities.
author: Dave Ramsey

text: I'm learning how to live in the present and be grateful for what's working rather than look for the 'what's not working' piece.
author: Ali MacGraw

text: Before you can win a game, you have to not lose it.
author: Chuck Noll

text: An aim in life is the only fortune worth finding.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: I think that sense of humor is important in marriage. A sense of humor gets people through marriage.
author: Kyle Chandler

text: I put my career in second place throughout both my marriages and it suffered. I don't regret it. You make choices. If you want a good marriage, you must pay attention to that. If you want to be independent, go ahead. You can't have it all.
author: Lauren Bacall

text: India and China have not shied away from addressing boundary questions, have wisdom to find a fair and mutually acceptable solution... We have been able to put all issues on the table.
author: Li Keqiang

text: As the Father has loved me, so have I loved you.
author: Jesus Christ

text: It's only fair that stable gay relationships of long standing should have the same rights and responsibilities as married couples. I know the image of gay marriage is to some people horrific and ludicrous.
author: Ian Mckellen

text: Love, the quest; marriage, the conquest; divorce, the inquest.
author: Helen Rowland

text: The friend in my adversity I shall always cherish most. I can better trust those who helped to relieve the gloom of my dark hours than those who are so ready to enjoy with me the sunshine of my prosperity.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

text: I'm so single. It's funny. I'm usually a relationship girl. I love being in love and having a partner in crime. But it's good to be your own partner in crime. God, that makes me sound like I have multiple-personality disorder.
author: Brittany Snow

text: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: I've been dancing since I was two, learning so many different styles. I like dancing to rap and hip-hop, but also the Strokes, the Hives, and the Vines with carefree randomness. There's always a way to move to something.
author: Jillian Hervey

text: People ask me all the time, 'What keeps you up at night?' And I say, 'Spicy Mexican food, weapons of mass destruction, and cyber attacks.'
author: Dutch Ruppersberger

text: It is a mistake to suppose that men succeed through success; they much oftener succeed through failures. Precept, study, advice, and example could never have taught them so well as failure has done.
author: Samuel Smiles

text: The beginning of love is to let those we love be perfectly themselves, and not to twist them to fit our own image. Otherwise we love only the reflection of ourselves we find in them.
author: Thomas Merton

text: Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Marriage has always been a state and local issue.
author: Rand Paul

text: You want success, and then when you do get it, you don't want it because of the attention.
author: Shirley Bassey

text: Only the pure in heart can make a good soup.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

text: Clearly older women and especially older women who have led an active life or elder women who successfully maneuver through their own family life have so much to teach us about sharing, patience, and wisdom.
author: Alice Walker

text: I think there are those individuals who are intimidated by really smart, talented people. But for me, surrounding yourself with great talent is the key to success.
author: Monika Chiang

text: Also, they don't understand - writing is language. The use of language. The language to create image, the language to create drama. It requires a skill of learning how to use language.
author: John Milius

text: I've got many close friends, but there's an awful lot about friendship that is not demonstrative in my case.
author: Warren Christopher

text: Do what you need to do and enjoy life as it happens.
author: John Scalzi

text: Let's not overlook, though, what we do know about the campaign finance scandal, and the fact the Chinese were involved in our presidential campaign and our congressional campaigns.
author: Fred Thompson

text: Success is the child of drudgery and perseverance. It cannot be coaxed or bribed; pay the price and it is yours.
author: Orison Swett Marden

text: I love the concept of togetherness and the entwinement of marriage.
author: William Shatner

text: Friendship, like love, is destroyed by long absence, though it may be increased by short intermissions.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: It seems the most logical thing in the world to believe that the natural resources of the Earth, upon which the race depends for food, clothing and shelter, should be owned collectively by the race instead of being the private property of a few social parasites.
author: Ralph Chaplin

text: Don't let fear or insecurity stop you from trying new things. Believe in yourself. Do what you love. And most importantly, be kind to others, even if you don't like them.
author: Stacy London

text: I know how to set an irrigation tube, and I helped with the harvest. I learned the law of the harvest without even knowing I was learning it. On the farm, you learn early that you reap what you sow.
author: Sheri L. Dew

text: Make it your habit not to be critical about small things.
author: Edward Everett Hale

text: I have always been pushed by the negative. The apparent failure of a play sends me back to my typewriter that very night, before the reviews are out. I am more compelled to get back to work than if I had a success.
author: Tennessee Williams

text: We provide food that customers love, day after day after day. People just want more of it.
author: Ray Kroc

text: God gives every bird its food, but He does not throw it into its nest.
author: Josiah Gilbert Holland

text: I'm very accepting with my age. It's like notches on your belt: experience, wisdom, and a different kind of beauty. There comes a day when you've become comfortable in your skin.
author: Zoe Saldana

text: The idea behind fast food is great - people want convenience.
author: Kimbal Musk

text: I love the beach. I love the sea. All my life I live within - in front of the sea.
author: Rafael Nadal

text: Friendship... is not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: I was a poor kid. I came from nothing. We didn't have any money; a lot of times we didn't have any food, and now, all of a sudden, I'm a superhero in a Marvel movie? Talk about the American dream, man - I'm living it.
author: David Bautista

text: Our greatest happiness does not depend on the condition of life in which chance has placed us, but is always the result of a good conscience, good health, occupation, and freedom in all just pursuits.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: In my definition of consciousness, consciousness is the same thing as life. What wisdom traditions also call spirit.
author: Deepak Chopra

text: Life is bigger than cinema. Cinema is just a part of life, so I never take success or failure seriously.
author: Pawan Kalyan

text: The federal government has been a proven failure in picking winners and losers in the energy sector.
author: Mike Pompeo

text: A poem begins in delight and ends in wisdom.
author: Robert Frost

text: Education must not simply teach work - it must teach Life.
author: W. E. B. Du Bois

text: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

text: You can do good work simply staying up all night and eating nothing but junk food, but probably not in the long term.
author: John Mulaney

text: I think the idea that you know who your inner self is on a daily basis, because... you know. What's good for you 25 years ago may not be good for you now. So, to keep in touch with that, I think that's the first ingredient for success. Because if you're a successful human being, everything else is gravy, I think.
author: Whoopi Goldberg

text: The unhappy truth is, learning is hard.
author: Tucker Carlson

text: Personally, I don't like the term 'success.' It's too arbitrary and too relative a thing. It's usually someone else's definition, not yours.
author: Ichiro Suzuki

text: I don't know that you're able to measure your aggregate wisdom as you go through life. I can't say that I ever feel that I'm sitting on top of a growing mound of wisdom.
author: Dylan Moran

text: In closing I wish to say that while I was sorely beset by a number of white riders in my racing days, I have also enjoyed the friendship of countless thousands of white men whom I class as among my closest friends.
author: Major Taylor

text: We need to accept that we won't always make the right decisions, that we'll screw up royally sometimes - understanding that failure is not the opposite of success, it's part of success.
author: Arianna Huffington

text: I did stand-up comedy for 18 years. Ten of those years were spent learning, four years were spent refining, and four years were spent in wild success. I was seeking comic originality, and fame fell on me as a byproduct. The course was more plodding than heroic.
author: Steve Martin

text: Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.
author: Confucius

text: You are almost not free, if you are teaching a group of graduate students, to become friends with one of them. I don't mean anything erotically charged, just a friendship.
author: Marilyn Hacker

text: Nothing so fortifies a friendship as a belief on the part of one friend that he is superior to the other.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: Going through an illness and then death of a close friend has changed my attitudes to friendship enormously.
author: Jane Green

text: It's like, 'Oh, well of course you want gay marriage, you're gay.' I think when heterosexual people are talking to their peers and they're like, 'This is an equal rights thing,' it's a little bit easier.
author: Jillian Michaels

text: There is only one real deprivation... and that is not to be able to give one's gifts to those one loves most.
author: May Sarton

text: Wisdom consists of the anticipation of consequences.
author: Norman Cousins

text: Marriage is give and take. You'd better give it to her or she'll take it anyway.
author: Joey Adams

text: In the transmission of human culture, people always attempt to replicate, to pass on to the next generation the skills and values of the parents, but the attempt always fails because cultural transmission is geared to learning, not DNA.
author: Gregory Bateson

text: There is as much wisdom in listening as there is in speaking - and that goes for all relationships, not just romantic ones.
author: Daniel Dae Kim

text: I follow my own advice: eat less, move more, eat lots of fruits, vegetables, and grains, and don't eat too much junk food. It leaves plenty of flexibility for eating an occasional junk food.
author: Marion Nestle

text: If you're a teenager in Palo Alto launching an app, you know from the outset how you plan to finance your business.
author: Natalie Massenet

text: No skill shapes a child's future success in school or in life more than the ability to read.
author: Bob Riley

text: Success is usually the culmination of controlling failure.
author: Sylvester Stallone

text: But if somebody dies, if something happens to you, there is a normal process of depression, it is part of being human, and some people view it as a learning experience etc.
author: Bob Geldof

text: I'm a very strong believer in listening and learning from others.
author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

text: A passionate belief in your business and personal objectives can make all the difference between success and failure. If you aren't proud of what you're doing, why should anybody else be?
author: Richard Branson

text: Life is a lot like jazz... it's best when you improvise.
author: George Gershwin

text: But, if you observe children learning in their first few years of life, you can see that they can and do learn on their own - we leave them alone to crawl, walk, talk, and gain control over their bodies. It happens without much help from parents.
author: Daniel Greenberg

text: Success can make you go one of two ways. It can make you a prima donna - or it can smooth the edges, take away the insecurities, let the nice things come out.
author: Barbara Walters

text: Even in the common affairs of life, in love, friendship, and marriage, how little security have we when we trust our happiness in the hands of others!
author: William Hazlitt

text: Never, never, never give up.
author: Winston Churchill

text: My argument is simple, which is, that for several thousand years in Western civilization, marriage has been the union of one man and one woman. Research is overwhelming that children need mothers and fathers.
author: Gary Bauer

text: To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded.
author: Bessie Anderson Stanley

text: Learning to distinguish the illegal immigrant from the legal immigrant does not solve the problem of illegal immigration.
author: Jan C. Ting

text: Smokey Robinson writes the heartfelt songs, whereas it was my job to write the songs about weakness and failure in love.
author: Elvis Costello

text: Frustration, although quite painful at times, is a very positive and essential part of success.
author: Bo Bennett

text: Don't be afraid of failure; be afraid of petty success.
author: Maude Adams

text: My theory on life is that life is beautiful. Life doesn't change. You have a day, and a night, and a month, and a year. We people change - we can be miserable or we can be happy. It's what you make of your life.
author: Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum

text: Winning is great, sure, but if you are really going to do something in life, the secret is learning how to lose. Nobody goes undefeated all the time. If you can pick up after a crushing defeat, and go on to win again, you are going to be a champion someday.
author: Wilma Rudolph

text: The worst part of success is, to me, adapting to it. It's scary.
author: Kendrick Lamar

text: He who lives by the crystal ball soon learns to eat ground glass.
author: Edgar Fiedler

text: Marrying for love may be a bit risky, but it is so honest that God can't help but smile on it.
author: Josh Billings

text: Advances in technology - hugely beneficial though they are - render us vulnerable in new ways. For instance, our interconnected world depends on elaborate networks: electric power grids, air traffic control, international finance, just-in-time delivery, and so forth.
author: Martin Rees

text: You never know what motivates you.
author: Cicely Tyson

text: Spend enough time around success and failure, and you learn a reverence for possibility.
author: Dale Dauten

text: Life is made up of sobs, sniffles, and smiles, with sniffles predominating.
author: O. Henry

text: Many of us spend half of our time wishing for things we could have if we didn't spend half our time wishing.
author: Alexander Woollcott

text: I have found that if you love life, life will love you back.
author: Arthur Rubinstein

text: Every picture has been a learning opportunity for me.
author: Sam Raimi

text: Success is having to worry about every damn thing in the world, except money.
author: Johnny Cash

text: True prayer is not asking God for love; it is learning to love, and to include all mankind in one affection. Prayer is the utilization of the love wherewith He loves us.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

text: The negative side of the American Dream comes when people pursue success at any cost, which in turn destroys the vision and the dream.
author: Azar Nafisi

text: Successful entrepreneurs find the balance between listening to their inner voice and staying persistent in driving for success - because sometimes success is waiting right across from the transitional bump that's disguised as failure.
author: Naveen Jain

text: Like a lovely orchid, or anything else that's nurtured, marriage prospers and grows, but if it's ignored, it withers.
author: Michael Douglas

text: What I want is to have people's notion of adulthood no longer be so defined by being a parent. There is some kind of conventional wisdom that you're not really a mature person until you become a parent.
author: Meghan Daum

text: Here in Hollywood you can actually get a marriage license printed on an Etch-A-Sketch.
author: Dennis Miller

text: When I graduated high school, I bought a guitar and, at first, didn't really think I'd get into the songwriting thing as much as I did. But after learning a few songs of other people's to play on the guitar, I got bored with that and just started writing songs on my own, and that's kinda how it came about.
author: Sam Hunt

text: It is the combination of reasonable talent and the ability to keep going in the face of defeat that leads to success.
author: Martin Seligman

text: The higher we are placed, the more humbly we should walk.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

text: A failure doesn't mean you are unworthy, nor does it preclude success on the next try.
author: Leonard Mlodinow

text: Each success only buys an admission ticket to a more difficult problem.
author: Henry Kissinger

text: May these vows and this marriage be blessed.
author: Rumi

text: The beginning of a friendship, the fact that two people out of the thousands around them can meet and connect and become friends, seems like a kind of magic to me. But maintaining a friendship requires work. I don't mean that as a bad thing. Good art requires work as well.
author: Charles de Lint

text: Poverty is about people lacking the tools they need to get on in life. And solving it is about tackling educational failure, antisocial behaviour, debt problems and addiction, and of course it's about work.
author: Theresa May

text: Although the troops have struck us, we throw it all behind and are glad to meet you in peace and friendship.
author: Black Kettle

text: Getting a divorce is always horrible because you feel you've failed. Everyone hates to give up on a marriage. You think your family's broken up.
author: Jerry Hall

text: Peace is the beauty of life. It is sunshine. It is the smile of a child, the love of a mother, the joy of a father, the togetherness of a family. It is the advancement of man, the victory of a just cause, the triumph of truth.
author: Menachem Begin

text: The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions.
author: Alfred Adler

text: It is essential to employ, trust, and reward those whose perspective, ability, and judgment are radically different from yours. It is also rare, for it requires uncommon humility, tolerance, and wisdom.
author: Dee Hock

text: I have friends in overalls whose friendship I would not swap for the favor of the kings of the world.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: Success is counted sweetest by those who never succeed.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: When people have a willpower failure, it's because they haven't anticipated a situation that's going to come along.
author: Charles Duhigg

text: We cease loving ourselves if no one loves us.
author: Madame de Stael

text: A so-called happy marriage corresponds to love as a correct poem to an improvised song.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

text: Moral science is better occupied when treating of friendship than of justice.
author: Thomas Aquinas

text: Particularly with internships, you have to work for a year with no money. How on Earth are you going to finance that?
author: Rob James-Collier

text: I haven't lived a perfect life. I have regrets. But that's from a lifetime of taking chances, making decisions, and trying not to be frozen. The only thing that I can do with my regrets is understand them.
author: Kevin Costner

text: The Reverend Jeremiah Wright would baptize Obama, perform his marriage to Michelle LaVaughn Robinson, baptize their daughters, and draw him into the raucous, restless family of faith that Obama had never known before.
author: Nancy Gibbs

text: Elegance is not a dispensable luxury but a factor that decides between success and failure.
author: Edsger Dijkstra

text: Through consciousness, our minds have the power to change our planet and ourselves. It is time we heed the wisdom of the ancient indigenous people and channel our consciousness and spirit to tend the garden and not destroy it.
author: Bruce Lipton

text: I think that, in addition of the intersection of media and technology, there has also been an intersection between technology and finance, which is something I find a little closer to home, seeing as I spend so much time covering Wall Street banks.
author: Kayla Tausche

text: Time is long but life is short.
author: Stevie Wonder

text: To embrace the whole world in friendship is wisdom. This wisdom is not changeable like the flowers that bloom and fade.
author: Thiruvalluvar

text: Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love.
author: Jane Austen

text: An empowered organisation is one in which individuals have the knowledge, skill, desire, and opportunity to personally succeed in a way that leads to collective organisational success.
author: Stephen Covey

text: Success, they taught me, is built on the foundation of courage, hard-work and individual responsibility. Despite what some would have us believe, success is not built on resentment and fears.
author: Susana Martinez

text: Success doesn't necessarily come from breakthrough innovation but from flawless execution. A great strategy alone won't win a game or a battle; the win comes from basic blocking and tackling.
author: Naveen Jain

text: Success to me is having ten honeydew melons and eating only the top half of each slice.
author: Barbra Streisand

text: I love wisdom. And you can never be great at anything unless you love it. Not be in love with it, but love the thing, admire the thing. And it seems that if you love the thing, and you don't just want to possess it, it will find you.
author: Maya Angelou

text: We've never been people that go around and confront people that have been financially successful and say, 'We hate you. We envy you because of how well you're doing.'
author: Marco Rubio

text: A very small degree of hope is sufficient to cause the birth of love.
author: Stendhal

text: Chalkboards being used inside the restaurant seem to be a good sign that the proprietors are proud of their food, and that's kind of nice, actually - it's a nice personal touch.
author: Fred Armisen

text: Working with people, the musical part is one thing but the personal part is totally different and just as critical. If the friendship is there and it's a lasting friendship, then it will take care of itself.
author: John Mayall

text: Giving responsibility is the key to success with boys, especially with the rowdiest and most difficult boys.
author: Robert Baden-Powell

text: Life itself still remains a very effective therapist.
author: Karen Horney

text: After I won the Oscar, my salary doubled, my friends tripled, my children became more popular at school, my butcher made a pass at me, and my maid hit me up for a raise.
author: Shirley Jones

text: Admitting failure is quite cleansing, but never - pleasurable.
author: Michael Morpurgo

text: I learned long ago, never to wrestle with a pig. You get dirty, and besides, the pig likes it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.
author: Og Mandino

text: The way to make money is to buy when blood is running in the streets.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: There are good intentions behind many people's conversion to veganism, including an admirable devotion to the well-being of animals and a justified skepticism about the crap the USDA allows manufacturers to put in our food. But it's hard to ignore the often sanctimonious nature of what some nutritionists view as an 'extremist' way of eating.
author: Julie Klausner

text: Just as a cautious businessman avoids investing all his capital in one concern, so wisdom would probably admonish us also not to anticipate all our happiness from one quarter alone.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: The decisions you make are a choice of values that reflect your life in every way.
author: Alice Waters

text: My failures may be my greatest successes. It is in failure that I have often drawn closer to God, learn to depend more on Him than myself, gained self-knowledge, and seen things in their right perspective.
author: Mother Angelica

text: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy, they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
author: Marcel Proust

text: My husband was in the war of the Crimea. It is terrible the hardships he went through, to be two months without going into a house, under the snow in trenches. And no food to get, maybe a biscuit in the day. And there was enough food there, he said, to feed all Ireland; but bad management, they could not get it.
author: Lady Gregory

text: It may happen sometimes that a long debate becomes the cause of a longer friendship. Commonly, those who dispute with one another at last agree.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: I believe that our teachers need more freedom to be creative in the classroom in order to maximize the time students spend learning, not the time they spend taking tests.
author: Gary Herbert

text: Getting divorced didn't sour me on the institution of marriage. I'll tell you what I'll never do: I'll never get divorced again.
author: Eddie Murphy

text: Feelings aroused by the touch of someone's hand, the sound of music, the smell of a flower, a beautiful sunset, a work of art, love, laughter, hope and faith - all work on both the unconscious and the conscious aspects of the self, and they have physiological consequences as well.
author: Bernie Siegel

text: I did stand-up comedy for 18 years. Ten of those years were spent learning, four years were spent refining, and four years were spent in wild success. I was seeking comic originality, and fame fell on me as a byproduct. The course was more plodding than heroic.
author: Steve Martin

text: You can be self-empowered and still learning about how you think about things daily.
author: Tori Amos

text: The extreme limit of wisdom, that's what the public calls madness.
author: Jean Cocteau

text: Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can't lose.
author: Bill Gates

text: I never was good at learning things. I did just enough work to pass. In my opinion it would have been wrong to do more than was just sufficient, so I worked as little as possible.
author: Manfred von Richthofen

text: The lunch in a normal American restaurant is very problematic for me. I don't like to have hot food for lunch.
author: Larry David

text: Start with God - the first step in learning is bowing down to God; only fools thumb their noses at such wisdom and learning.
author: King Solomon

text: Every day is a new opportunity. You can build on yesterday's success or put its failures behind and start over again. That's the way life is, with a new game every day, and that's the way baseball is.
author: Bob Feller

text: I have a terrific marriage, but unlike a lot of relationships where they ebb and flow, no matter what happens you fall deeper and deeper in love every day. It's kind of the best thing that can happen to you. It's thrilling.
author: Hugh Jackman

text: Finishing food is about the tiny touches. In the last seconds you can change everything.
author: Mario Batali

text: I think I've discovered the secret of life - you just hang around until you get used to it.
author: Charles M. Schulz

text: Hitch your wagon to a star.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Even after marriage, our home is important for us.
author: Mahesh Babu

text: To my young friends out there: Life can be great, but not when you can't see it. So, open your eyes to life: to see it in the vivid colors that God gave us as a precious gift to His children, to enjoy life to the fullest, and to make it count. Say yes to your life.
author: Nancy Reagan

text: It is one of the severest tests of friendship to tell your friend his faults. So to love a man that you cannot bear to see a stain upon him, and to speak painful truth through loving words, that is friendship.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

text: Waking up every day and loving someone who may or may not love us back, whose safety we can't ensure, who may stay in our lives or may leave without a moment's notice, who may be loyal to the day they die or betray us tomorrow - that's vulnerability.
author: Brene Brown

text: I'm only just learning what language to use when I want my microphone turned down, you know, because it's all so new to me. It can be quite difficult on a daily basis to communicate with the people I work with, so I'm just looking forward to knowing more.
author: Duffy

text: Swim upstream. Go the other way. Ignore the conventional wisdom.
author: Sam Walton

text: Sincere friendship towards God, in all who believe him to be properly an intelligent, willing being, does most apparently, directly, and strongly incline to prayer; and it no less disposes the heart strongly to desire to have our infinitely glorious.
author: Jonathan Edwards

text: It is important for investors to understand what they do and don't know. Learn to recognize that you cannot possibly know what is going to happen in the future, and any investment plan that is dependent on accurately forecasting where markets will be next year is doomed to failure.
author: Barry Ritholtz

text: Grief can be the garden of compassion. If you keep your heart open through everything, your pain can become your greatest ally in your life's search for love and wisdom.
author: Rumi

text: The more things you do, the more you can do.
author: Lucille Ball

text: Love is a great beautifier.
author: Louisa May Alcott

text: You can spend the day at work, but when you go home, and you're in the role of a father or a husband, you don't have to remind yourself that you shouldn't tell your wife to hold the messages. If you do, that marriage is not going to last very long.
author: Hannah Simone

text: I hope our wisdom will grow with our power, and teach us, that the less we use our power the greater it will be.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: I don't believe in twisting yourself into knots of excuses and explanations over the food you make.
author: Julia Child

text: Even as far back as when I started acting at 14, I know I've never considered failure.
author: Jennifer Lawrence

text: Once I found professional happiness, it gave me time to think about other areas in my life in which I wasn't happy. The next obvious candidate for introspection was my marriage.
author: Megyn Kelly

text: Each of us has been put on earth with the ability to do something well. We cheat ourselves and the world if we don't use that ability as best we can.
author: George Allen, Sr.

text: The secret of success is to be in harmony with existence, to be always calm to let each wave of life wash us a little farther up the shore.
author: Cyril Connolly

text: Life is never easy for those who dream.
author: Robert James Waller

text: Many spiritual teachers - in Buddhism, in Islam - have talked about first-hand experience of the world as an important part of the path to wisdom, to enlightenment.
author: bell hooks

text: Only solitary men know the full joys of friendship. Others have their family; but to a solitary and an exile, his friends are everything.
author: Willa Cather

text: As a graduate student, I wrote a long paper connecting the dots between mathematical models of learning and language development in children. It was published in a major journal.
author: Steven Pinker

text: We may find in the long run that tinned food is a deadlier weapon than the machine-gun.
author: George Orwell

text: I always preferred my father's pasta the next day, when he'd put it in a hot oven with heaps of extra cheese. It would emerge slightly burned and very crisp on top.
author: Yotam Ottolenghi

text: I enjoy the work, I enjoy every minute of my professional life.
author: Jose Mourinho

text: Forgiveness is that subtle thread that binds both love and friendship. Without forgiveness, you may not even have a child one day.
author: George Foreman

text: Federal regulations forbid delaying inspections for fracture-critical bridges like the fallen Minneapolis bridge - the kind with a lack of redundancy in design, so that a single failure in a load-bearing part can cause the entire bridge to collapse.
author: Bill Dedman

text: I went to college at QUT: Queensland University of Technology. I studied for a Bachelors in finance and acting.
author: Brenton Thwaites

text: The greatest use of a life is to spend it on something that will outlast it.
author: William James

text: Coming to terms with the fact that my marriage was a failure was devastating and very difficult.
author: Sarah McLachlan

text: Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a listening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of caring, all of which have the potential to turn a life around.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: All the commandments: You shall not commit adultery, you shall not kill, you shall not steal, you shall not covet, and so on, are summed up in this single command: You must love your neighbor as yourself.
author: Jesus Christ

text: As an actor, you just want to work, and then you just want to be on a show or have a job that you love, and you hope that job will last - those things have happened. To have that platform to then talk about something that is very personal to me like marriage equality, it feels like a gift. I try and really respect that voice and not abuse it.
author: Jesse Tyler Ferguson

text: I would be willing to do almost anything to make Art happy. I care about our friendship. The only thing I won't do is change the essence of my work.
author: Paul Simon

text: Never stand still. Only stand still enough to learn, and once you stop learning in that stance, move off. Always keep yourself engaged, in theater, in whatever job you can get. If you can't get an acting job, then go backstage. Or take tickets. But be around actors because that is where you will primarily learn.
author: Ed Asner

text: China has been committed to the independent foreign policy of peace and has developed friendship and cooperation with all countries on the basis of the Five Principles of Peaceful Coexistence.
author: Hu Jintao

text: Well, until this very day, I'm still learning.
author: Dennis Brown

text: I have learned that only two things are necessary to keep one's wife happy. First, let her think she's having her own way. And second, let her have it.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

text: For it is mutual trust, even more than mutual interest that holds human associations together. Our friends seldom profit us but they make us feel safe. Marriage is a scheme to accomplish exactly that same end.
author: H. L. Mencken

text: New Orleans has a lot of good food.
author: Lee Byung-hun

text: Every two months, I allow myself a splurge day where I eat thick, doughy pizza from Pizzeria Uno or an ice cream sundae from my store with birthday-cake ice cream, Marshmallow Fluff, and toppings mixed in.
author: Dylan Lauren

text: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: Justice turns the scale, bringing to some learning through suffering.
author: Aeschylus

text: I do believe in soulmates and happy/successful marriages. No marriage can be happy 24x7 for 365 days. Both partners have to make the relationship work, is what I believe in.
author: Kajol

text: A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!
author: Doug Larson

text: I've learned that friendship does not equate business, business does not equate friendship.
author: Jill Scott

text: I'm not scared of anything in particular, but I am motivated by a fear of failure as opposed to a need to succeed.
author: Heston Blumenthal

text: The problem with marriage is that it ends every night after making love, and it must be rebuilt every morning before breakfast.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

text: You cannot open a book without learning something.
author: Confucius

text: My dad was a man of great wisdom in his short time here.
author: Bonnie Hunt

text: The two most important requirements for major success are: first, being in the right place at the right time, and second, doing something about it.
author: Ray Kroc

text: The Gross National Product measures neither our wit nor our courage, neither our wisdom nor our learning, neither our compassion nor our devotion to our country. It measures everything, in short, except that which makes life worthwhile, and it can tell us everything about America - except whether we are proud to be Americans.
author: Robert Kennedy

text: I was so ready to become a mom. Actually, I was ready secondarily to become a mom. I was so ready to have the intimacy and commitment of marriage.
author: Alanis Morissette

text: Love is often the fruit of marriage.
author: Moliere

text: A lot of people tell me a lot of things about my conduct, my game, my future... but I try to stay away from their words of wisdom. I don't let it distract me. On the field, you will be facing the ball alone. If you fail, you will the only one to blame. So, you should be the one deciding for yourself.
author: Virat Kohli

text: The only things worth learning are the things you learn after you know it all.
author: Harry S Truman

text: Open your eyes, look within. Are you satisfied with the life you're living?
author: Bob Marley

text: Most people are enduring a marginalized isolation. One of the great obstacles to modern friendships is the 'religion of rush.' People are rushing all the time through time. Friendship takes time.
author: John O'Donohue

text: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: If you set out to be liked, you would be prepared to compromise on anything at any time, and you would achieve nothing.
author: Margaret Thatcher

text: Steve Jobs, Bill Gates and Mark Zuckerberg didn't finish college. Too much emphasis is placed on formal education - I told my children not to worry about their grades but to enjoy learning.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: Success to me is being a good person, treating people well.
author: David LaChapelle

text: What is this drive to be thinner, prettier, better dressed, other? Who exactly is this other and what does she look like beyond the jacket she's wearing or the food she's not eating? What might we be doing, thinking, feeling about if we didn't think about body image, ever?
author: Caroline Knapp

text: There's no way that I could have known about a 72-oz. steak challenge in Amarillo unless thousands upon thousands of locals and travellers alike had attempted it. I guess if 'Man V Food' is me paying homage to these legends, then I suppose 'Man V Food Nation' is the legacy.
author: Adam Richman

text: What is called genius is the abundance of life and health.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Life would be infinitely happier if we could only be born at the age of eighty and gradually approach eighteen.
author: Mark Twain

text: The bird is powered by its own life and by its motivation.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

text: The greatest trap in our life is not success, popularity or power, but self-rejection.
author: Henri Nouwen

text: In order to succeed you must fail, so that you know what not to do the next time.
author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

text: I was not good in school. I could never read very fast or very well. I got tested for learning disabilities, for dyslexia. Then I got put on Ritalin and Dexedrine. I took those starting in the eighth grade. As soon as they pumped that drug into me, it would focus me right in.
author: Channing Tatum

text: Under capitalism, man exploits man. Under communism, it's just the opposite.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

text: Do not blame anybody for your mistakes and failures.
author: Bernard Baruch

text: Prejudice is sinful. All blood flows red. And the most harmful and foolish kind of prejudice is prejudice against yourself. Every woman is your sister, and every woman needs her sisters. So try to give other women the courtesy of your compassion, respect, and forgiveness. Love yourself despite - and because of - your flaws.
author: Jewell Parker Rhodes

text: I love food and I love everything involved with food. I love the fun of it. I love restaurants. I love cooking, although I don't cook very much. I love kitchens.
author: Alma Guillermoprieto

text: A man can live and be healthy without killing animals for food; therefore, if he eats meat, he participates in taking animal life merely for the sake of his appetite.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: An artist must never be a prisoner. Prisoner? An artist should never be a prisoner of himself, prisoner of style, prisoner of reputation, prisoner of success, etc.
author: Henri Matisse

text: My decision to end my marriage was such a risk to lose ratings and lose my fan base. I had to take that risk for my inner peace and to be happy with myself.
author: Kim Kardashian

text: I don't think one should attribute the success and failure of a film to a single actor. When you decide to do a film, you weigh the pros and cons before taking a call. Only when you run out of patience, get insecure, and feel your career is heading nowhere do you sign anything that comes your way.
author: Rakul Preet Singh

text: To these ideals which were instilled in me when I was a youth, I attribute in a large degree the success that was mine on the bicycle tracks of the world.
author: Major Taylor

text: Sometimes people walk into plays by accident - they don't even know what they're looking at; they just think to give it a chance. That can be the beginning of a long friendship.
author: Dylan Baker

text: I am not someone who is ashamed of my past. I'm actually really proud. I know I made a lot of mistakes, but they, in turn, were my life lessons.
author: Drew Barrymore

text: I love life because what more is there?
author: Anthony Hopkins

text: Iraq's Sunnis need to be brought back into the fold. They need to feel as though they have a stake in the success of Iraq rather than a stake in its failure.
author: David Petraeus

text: Marriage is a school itself. Also, having children. Becoming a father changed my whole life. It taught me as if by revelation.
author: Abraham Maslow

text: I love you when you bow in your mosque, kneel in your temple, pray in your church. For you and I are sons of one religion, and it is the spirit.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: One of the most basic factors in sports is that winning becomes a habit, and losing is the same way. When failure starts to feel normal in your life or your work or even your darkest vices, you won't have to go looking for trouble, because trouble will find you. Count on it.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

text: I think we do need to try to not just rely on the central bank to, in its wisdom, adjust interest rates, but allow for people to avoid being exposed to inflation risk.
author: Robert J. Shiller

text: I have moments where I feel incredibly ugly or fat, and it sucks, you know? I'll usually try to keep a positive attitude because I'm really so grateful for where I am and the life I get to live, but I definitely have to work hard not to feel insecure.
author: Charlotte McKinney

text: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: Italy has great food and Barcelona has great energy.
author: Stefon Harris

text: You know, failure hurts. Any kind of failure stings. If you live in the sting, you will - undoubtedly - fail. My way of getting past the sting is to say no, I'm just not going to let this get me down.
author: Sonia Sotomayor

text: Barack knows the American Dream because he's lived it, and he wants everyone in this country to have that same opportunity, no matter who we are or where we're from or what we look like or who we love.
author: Michelle Obama

text: People used to ask me for advice, and I'd say, 'Please, don't ask me!' Yes, I did economics at Oxford, but that's not the same as having a broad knowledge of personal finance.
author: Sophie Kinsella

text: Food feeds both the body and soul - there are clear reasons to eat a balanced diet, but there are also reasons you cling to your mom's secret chicken noodle soup recipe when you're sick.
author: Michael Mina

text: Marriage counselors in particular all strongly recommend divorcees try to understand their role in a divorce before re-marrying. Statistics show if you re-marry before you've clearly seen things from the biter's point of view - you're re-bounded to fail again!
author: Karen Salmansohn

text: I am not afraid of storms for I am learning how to sail my ship.
author: Louisa May Alcott

text: In world mythology, there are countless examples of tragic characters whose greatest strength is also the source of their undoing. But the ancient Greeks and Romans also held the view that acceptance is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Simon Van Booy

text: And ever has it been known that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: Irony is the gaiety of reflection and the joy of wisdom.
author: Anatole France

text: Let's practice motivation and love, not discrimination and hate.
author: Zendaya

text: Entire ignorance is not so terrible or extreme an evil, and is far from being the greatest of all; too much cleverness and too much learning, accompanied with ill bringing-up, are far more fatal.
author: Plato

text: The greatest healing therapy is friendship and love.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

text: No water, no life. No blue, no green.
author: Sylvia Earle

text: Whenever you argue with another wiser than yourself in order that others may admire your wisdom, they will discover your ignorance.
author: Saadi

text: Anyone who has to fight, even with the most modern weapons, against an enemy in complete command of the air, fights like a savage against modern European troops, under the same handicaps and with the same chances of success.
author: Erwin Rommel

text: You're going to go through tough times - that's life. But I say, 'Nothing happens to you, it happens for you.' See the positive in negative events.
author: Joel Osteen

text: Failure isn't an option. I've erased the word 'fear' from my vocabulary, and I think when you erase fear, you can't fail.
author: Alicia Keys

text: To be successful, you have to have your heart in your business and your business in your heart.
author: Thomas J. Watson

text: The Bay of Pigs became a metaphor for feckless folly and failure.
author: Pat Buchanan

text: Whatever the medium, there is the difficulty, challenge, fascination and often productive clumsiness of learning a new method: the wonderful puzzles and problems of translating with new materials.
author: Helen Frankenthaler

text: I really love learning about animals. I pull from a deck of spirit animal cards. You pull one, and it's about 50 or 60 different animals, and then that day you read whichever animal you pull. And it kind of gives you insight.
author: Brie Larson

text: Success is blocked by concentrating on it and planning for it... Success is shy - it won't come out while you're watching.
author: Tennessee Williams

text: Life is best when you are in love.
author: Michael Moriarty

text: A birthday is just another day where you go to work and people give you love. Age is just a state of mind, and you are as old as you think you are. You have to count your blessings and be happy.
author: Abhishek Bachchan

text: He who refuses to stoop, who cannot be bribed by the promise of success or the fear of failure - who walks the highway of the right, and in disaster stands erect, is the only victor.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

text: We're born with success. It is only others who point out our failures, and what they attribute to us as failure.
author: Whoopi Goldberg

text: I can install toilets. I know all about the wax ring. I can tile floors. I'm learning how to do basic wiring.
author: Sandra Bullock

text: We need 4 hugs a day for survival. We need 8 hugs a day for maintenance. We need 12 hugs a day for growth.
author: Virginia Satir

text: Acceptance is not love. You love a person because he or she has lovable traits, but you accept everybody just because they're alive and human.
author: Albert Ellis

text: I've become a professional failure - in order to pay the mortgage I have to remain unemployed. Luckily, a disaster always seems to befall me at exactly the right moment.
author: Toby Young

text: 'Safe Harbor' is a state of mind... it's the place - in reality or metaphor - to which one goes in times of trouble or worry. It can be a friendship, marriage, church, garden, beach, poem, prayer, or song.
author: Luanne Rice

text: I have a lack of fear, whereas in the past the fear of failure was a powerful motivator. Anyway, I have great expectations for the future, but I just don't know if I'm the monarch of all I survey.
author: Sylvester Stallone

text: I love people who make me laugh. I honestly think it's the thing I like most, to laugh. It cures a multitude of ills. It's probably the most important thing in a person.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Gold and silver, like other commodities, have an intrinsic value, which is not arbitrary, but is dependent on their scarcity, the quantity of labour bestowed in procuring them, and the value of the capital employed in the mines which produce them.
author: David Ricardo

text: When it comes to love, the English language bears no shortage of cliches.
author: Sarah MacLean

text: Success listens only to applause. To all else it is deaf.
author: Elias Canetti

text: They who have conquered doubt and fear have conquered failure.
author: James Allen

text: Alzheimer's disease is never an 'accident' in a marriage. It falls under the purview of God's sovereignty. In the case of someone with Alzheimer's, this means God's unconditional and sacrificial love has an opportunity to be even more gloriously displayed in a life together.
author: Joni Eareckson Tada

text: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: Never forget the three powerful resources you always have available to you: love, prayer, and forgiveness.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

text: I consider wisdom supernatural because it isn't taught by men - it's a gift from God.
author: Joyce Meyer

text: One way to keep momentum going is to have constantly greater goals.
author: Michael Korda

text: When you accept that failure is a good thing, it can actually be a huge propeller toward success.
author: Whitney Wolfe

text: I came seriously close to getting married four times, and each time I backed off in fear or for one reason or another. Each occasion was different, but in hindsight when I look at the people involved, it wasn't a bad thing what I did. I think it may have been more complex had the marriage taken place.
author: Ratan Tata

text: I don't look at football as a violent, barbaric sport. It's a very spiritual sport, especially for someone facing the challenges during a game: the fear of failure, the fear of getting too big an ego, of making a mistake and everybody criticizing you.
author: Troy Polamalu

text: We will all fail in life, but nobody has to be a failure. Failing at a thing doesn't make you a failure. You are only a failure when you quit trying.
author: Joyce Meyer

text: I never see failure as failure, but only as the game I must play and win.
author: Tom Hopkins

text: Failure will happen. It's a normal part of the startup process.
author: Steve Blank

text: I felt like a failure for so long because I wasn't able to access myself in the way I knew I would have if I was going to make music that mattered. I knew I was going to have to learn how to be honest.
author: John Grant

text: The sacrifices of friendship were beautiful in her eyes as long as she was not asked to make them.
author: Hector Hugh Munro

text: I believe marriage is a human right, not a state right.
author: Martin O'Malley

text: In the Hillary Clinton model, the wife chooses to support the straying husband while wearing a distressed and presumably pained expression in public. She stays in the marriage as a way to serve both her personal ambition as well as their shared ambition to achieve ever-greater positions of power and influence.
author: Monica Crowley

text: I grow old learning something new every day.
author: Solon

text: The Constitution of the United States has absolutely nothing to say about a constitutional right to same-sex marriage. Were the federal courts to recognize such a right, it would be completely without constitutional basis.
author: Newt Gingrich

text: I am blessed to have so many great things in my life - family, friends and God. All will be in my thoughts daily.
author: Lil' Kim

text: Cooking is like love. It should be entered into with abandon or not at all.
author: Harriet Van Horne

text: But the important thing about learning to wait, I feel sure, is to know what you are waiting for.
author: Anna Neagle

text: If I've learned anything through all of this, it's that each and every day is a canvas waiting to be painted - an opportunity for love, for fun, for living, for learning.
author: Craig Sager

text: The enemies cannot destroy the king who has at his service the respect and friendship of the wise men who can find fault, disagree, and correct him.
author: Thiruvalluvar

text: Take those chances and you can achieve greatness, whereas if you go conservative, you'll never know. I truly believe what doesn't kill you makes you stronger. Even if you fail, learning and moving on is sometimes the best thing.
author: Danica Patrick

text: Financial crises are like fireworks: they illuminate the sky even as they go pop.
author: James Buchan

text: In this life, we have to make many choices. Some are very important choices. Some are not. Many of our choices are between good and evil. The choices we make, however, determine to a large extent our happiness or our unhappiness, because we have to live with the consequences of our choices.
author: James E. Faust

text: I've always believed that it's important to show a new look periodically. Predictability can lead to failure.
author: T. Boone Pickens

text: Intemperance and intolerance serve no one, and hatred guarantees failure.
author: Edward Brooke

text: Spiritually, we have marginalized the Bible. We've trivialized marriage, and we've neutralized the church. America today is in great turmoil. It feels like the soul of our nation has been taken from us.
author: David Jeremiah

text: If you want a love message to be heard, it has got to be sent out. To keep a lamp burning, we have to keep putting oil in it.
author: Mother Teresa

text: I can make dressing - or stuffing. Y'all call it stuffing up here, we call it dressing down there. It's really good dressing. That family recipe was passed on, and I love to make that.
author: Edie Brickell

text: I am always ready to learn although I do not always like being taught.
author: Winston Churchill

text: The more one judges, the less one loves.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: My marriage is on the rocks again, yeah, my wife just broke up with her boyfriend.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

text: Success has always been a great liar.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: I like marriage. I feel very secure. It helps when you are in love with the person you are married to.
author: Claire Danes

text: I was convicted of three misdemeanors of willful failure to file a form.
author: Wesley Snipes

text: Love has reasons which reason cannot understand.
author: Blaise Pascal

text: Suffering passes, while love is eternal. That's a gift that you have received from God. Don't waste it.
author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

text: The truth is that there is only one terminal dignity - love. And the story of a love is not important - what is important is that one is capable of love. It is perhaps the only glimpse we are permitted of eternity.
author: Helen Hayes

text: Yom Kippur, the Day of Atonement, is the holy of holies of Jewish time. It is that rarest of phenomena, a Jewish festival without food. Instead it is a day of fasting and prayer, introspection and self-judgment when, collectively and repeatedly, we confess our sins and pray to be written into God's Book of Life.
author: Jonathan Sacks

text: Success is neither magical nor mysterious. Success is the natural consequence of consistently applying the basic fundamentals.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Without courage, wisdom bears no fruit.
author: Baltasar Gracian

text: In finding love, I think it's important to be patient. In being in a relationship, I think it's important to be honest, to communicate, to respect and trust, and to strive to give more than you take.
author: Kina Grannis

text: I think it's important to find the little things in everyday life that make you happy.
author: Paula Cole

text: I believe that you can, by taking some simple and inexpensive measures, lead a longer life and extend your years of well-being. My most important recommendation is that you take vitamins every day in optimum amounts to supplement the vitamins that you receive in your food.
author: Linus Pauling

text: No one has ever loved anyone the way everyone wants to be loved.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

text: Life must be lived as play.
author: Plato

text: Some argue that now isn't the time to push the green agenda - that all efforts should be on preventing a serious recession. That is a false choice. It fails to recognise that climate change and our carbon reliance is part of problem - high fuel prices and food shortages due to poor crop yields compound today's financial difficulties.
author: Lucy Powell

text: Colombia is so different to what I know, and every aspect of the country is different to England, and I loved it. I loved the culture and the food, and the coffee was amazing. The place that we were was stunning, and it really was quite an amazing experience to film out there.
author: Tom Holland

text: Set yourself earnestly to see what you are made to do, and then set yourself earnestly to do it.
author: Phillips Brooks

text: He has no enemies, but is intensely disliked by his friends.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I like marriage. The idea.
author: Toni Morrison

text: The rate of interest acts as a link between income-value and capital-value.
author: Irving Fisher

text: Everywhere, people are discovering that doing things more slowly often means doing them better and enjoying them more. It means living life instead of rushing through it. You can apply this to everything from food to parenting to work.
author: Carl Honore

text: That is what learning is. You suddenly understand something you've understood all your life, but in a new way.
author: Doris Lessing

text: There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Among all the tests President Obama faced in his first term, his biggest failure was climate change.
author: Jeff Goodell

text: The knack of flying is learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss.
author: Douglas Adams

text: It is a mistake for women to think that life begins only with marriage. A woman can and must have an identity and feel useful, valued, and needed whether she is single or married. She must feel that she can do something for someone else that no one else ever born can do.
author: James E. Faust

text: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The moment I first heard love I gave up my soul, my heart, and my eyes.
author: Rumi

text: One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it. But to sacrifice what you are and to live without belief, that is a fate more terrible than dying.
author: Joan of Arc

text: Kids love food. It's about putting materials out there that get kids thinking about food - to get kids interacting about food. It's about simple things, like kids thinking about pasta - getting kids to work with food.
author: Guy Fieri

text: I love the sounds and the power of pounding water, whether it is the waves or a waterfall.
author: Mike May

text: Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right.' Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you may have at your command, and better tools will be found as you go along.
author: George Herbert

text: It is a kind of spiritual snobbery that makes people think they can be happy without money.
author: Albert Camus
