text: I've got some great guy friends. They can start out as crushes. But when you realize something isn't going to happen, you make a choice whether or not the friendship is worth it. And it usually is. Then you can laugh about the fact that you used to have a crush on him or he had one on you.
author: Courteney Cox

text: It's only through listening that you learn, and I never want to stop learning.
author: Drew Barrymore

text: You must accept responsibility for your actions, but not the credit for your achievements.
author: Denis Waitley

text: The three ordinary things that we often don't pay enough attention to, but which I believe are the drivers of all success, are hard work, perseverance, and basic honesty.
author: Azim Premji

text: There's a time in your life where you're not quite sure where you are. You think everything's perfect, but it's not perfect... Then one day you wake up and you can't quite picture yourself in the situation you're in. But the secret is, if you can picture yourself doing anything in life, you can do it.
author: Tom DeLonge

text: If love is the treasure, laughter is the key.
author: Yakov Smirnoff

text: It is of practical value to learn to like yourself. Since you must spend so much time with yourself you might as well get some satisfaction out of the relationship.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: If there is such a thing as a good marriage, it is because it resembles friendship rather than love.
author: Michel de Montaigne

text: Love begins at home, and it is not how much we do... but how much love we put in that action.
author: Mother Teresa

text: I have a simple philosophy: Fill what's empty. Empty what's full. Scratch where it itches.
author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

text: I slept and dreamt that life was joy. I awoke and saw that life was service. I acted and behold, service was joy.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

text: Rituals, anthropologists will tell us, are about transformation. The rituals we use for marriage, baptism or inaugurating a president are as elaborate as they are because we associate the ritual with a major life passage, the crossing of a critical threshold, or in other words, with transformation.
author: Abraham Verghese

text: Canadians know that the promise of a recession didn't happen because of anything we did here. If you look at all the causes of the recession, problems in mortgage markets, the problems in the banking sector, the problems in government finance in countries like Greece, none of those problems were in present Canada.
author: Stephen Harper

text: The deep joy we take in the company of people with whom we have just recently fallen in love is undisguisable.
author: John Cheever

text: Wine is bottled poetry.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: Falling in love and having a relationship are two different things.
author: Keanu Reeves

text: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot live without a spiritual life.
author: Buddha

text: If you do not express your own original ideas, if you do not listen to your own being, you will have betrayed yourself.
author: Rollo May

text: The wisdom of God is so great that He also knows exactly what I would think and do under every possible circumstance and situation, and he placed me in that state of life and situation best suited for my salvation.
author: Mother Angelica

text: Women always excel men in that sort of wisdom which comes from experience. To be a woman is in itself a terrible experience.
author: H. L. Mencken

text: Capitalism, after all, is no fun when real failure becomes a possibility.
author: James Surowiecki

text: I'm a little skeptical about using the Constitution this way, but I also believe marriage is between a man and a woman and that the courts shouldn't legislate this matter.
author: Pete Coors

text: Success is the maximum utilization of the ability that you have.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Success is a process, a quality of mind and way of being, an outgoing affirmation of life.
author: Alex Noble

text: Wisdom prepares for the worst, but folly leaves the worst for the day when it comes.
author: Richard Cecil

text: The difference between average people and achieving people is their perception of and response to failure.
author: John C. Maxwell

text: Friendship may, and often does, grow into love, but love never subsides into friendship.
author: Lord Byron

text: I was interested in political failure here in the U.S. The way we're failing to work together to solve even our smallest problems, let alone the complex ones.
author: Paolo Bacigalupi

text: I have worked very hard to shed away my chocolate boy image in order to get a tough look for this action entertainer. I am confident of my success and would love to dedicate the same to Director Balachandar sir.
author: Uday Kiran

text: In the old days, variety turns like me learned how to cope with failure - we all had nights when we 'died' on stage - but today's youngsters simply don't have that experience. For them, it really is instant make or break time - hence, all the tears and, hence, all the potential emotional damage.
author: Bruce Forsyth

text: Giving opens the way for receiving.
author: Florence Scovel Shinn

text: When I had just started 'Cheers,' my nerves were ajangle, to put it mildly. I was absolutely terrified. What you're learning is to not show the fear, and to ultimately overcome it so that the level of relaxation is commensurate with the level of tension.
author: Woody Harrelson

text: If we want to improve American food and make it much cheaper, we should deregulate the food trucks and the other street vendors, provided they meet certain sanitation standards. Many cities have already moved down this path, and people are not keeling over with salmonella.
author: Tyler Cowen

text: Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: I do not regard a broker as a member of the human race.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: Consult not your fears but your hopes and your dreams. Think not about your frustrations, but about your unfulfilled potential. Concern yourself not with what you tried and failed in, but with what it is still possible for you to do.
author: Pope John XXIII

text: I am a big, confident, happy woman who had a loving childhood, a pleasant career, and a wonderful marriage. I feel very lucky.
author: Maeve Binchy

text: People with a sense of humor tend to be less egocentric and more realistic in their view of the world and more humble in moments of success and less defeated in times of travail.
author: Bob Newhart

text: I was always a junk food person, still am.
author: Dolly Parton

text: I love spending time with my friends and family. The simplest things in life give me the most pleasure: cooking a good meal, enjoying my friends.
author: Cindy Morgan

text: The fall of dropping water wears away the Stone.
author: Lucretius

text: We are driven by five genetic needs: survival, love and belonging, power, freedom, and fun.
author: William Glasser

text: New Age values are conscious evolution, a non-sectarian society, a non-military culture, global sharing, healing the environment, sustainable economies, self-determination, social justice, economic empowerment of the poor, love, compassion in action, going beyond religious fundamentalism, going beyond nationalism-extreme nationalism, culture.
author: Deepak Chopra

text: Cheerfully fessing up to our failures turns crazy mind off, humility and compassion on. I learned this in a karate dojo that had a strange tradition. Everyone there loved recounting failure stories, and after an evening of smacking one another, we'd sit and have a beer while the students swapped tales of martial arts disaster.
author: Martha Beck

text: Successful people maintain a positive focus in life no matter what is going on around them. They stay focused on their past successes rather than their past failures, and on the next action steps they need to take to get them closer to the fulfillment of their goals rather than all the other distractions that life presents to them.
author: Jack Canfield

text: A constant struggle, a ceaseless battle to bring success from inhospitable surroundings, is the price of all great achievements.
author: Orison Swett Marden

text: I believe in the sanctity of marriage.
author: Sam Brownback

text: I really wasn't even aware that Batman and Superman had this kind of grudging friendship.
author: Mark Valley

text: I felt a failure because I couldn't sustain myself from what I earned from my writing. My day jobs were what mattered, and it was hard to even get those because universities wouldn't hire me as a real writer.
author: Sandra Cisneros

text: If you want to be found stand where the seeker seeks.
author: Sidney Lanier

text: Failure in Afghanistan would have profound consequences for our national security. It would undermine the NATO alliance structure that has been the bedrock of Britain's defence for the last 60 years... I will not allow this to happen on my watch.
author: Bob Ainsworth

text: My success just evolved from working hard at the business at hand each day.
author: Johnny Carson

text: To some it may be a thrill to be known, to me it's a thrill to start a friendship even up.
author: Christopher Knight

text: I didn't have a regular school experience and wanted a more abstract way of learning. I started exploring in lots of different creative ways. It gave me the opportunity to travel and play music, so it was good for me.
author: Brie Larson

text: The hours of folly are measured by the clock; but of wisdom, no clock can measure.
author: William Blake

text: The woman is a gentle, loving bond who encourages, consoles, builds, reconciles, and makes all things new and vibrant. The woman is strength in time of suffering, courageous in failure, intuitive in time of danger. A woman is ingenuous when all fails, resourceful in times of want, and a true helpmate for man.
author: Mother Angelica

text: I'd always intended to make 'Far North' straight after 'The Warrior.' We had the rights to the short story, the script was in development, and I knew where I wanted to shoot it. It just took a long time getting the script together and raising the finance.
author: Asif Kapadia

text: Learning never exhausts the mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: It is wisdom in prosperity, when all is as thou wouldn't have it, to fear and suspect the worst.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

text: It is plain to me that our prelates, in granting indulgences, do commonly blaspheme the wisdom of God.
author: John Wycliffe

text: I've known entrepreneurs who were not great salespeople, or didn't know how to code, or were not particularly charismatic leaders. But I don't know of any entrepreneurs who have achieved any level of success without persistence and determination.
author: Harvey Mackay

text: Art school had taught me it was far better to be a flamboyant failure than any kind of benign success.
author: Malcolm Mclaren

text: 'Cars' was about Lightning McQueen learning to slow down and to enjoy life. The journey is the reward.
author: John Lasseter

text: There are two great days in a person's life - the day we are born and the day we discover why.
author: William Barclay

text: Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone - we find it with another.
author: Thomas Merton

text: Eating is not merely a material pleasure. Eating well gives a spectacular joy to life and contributes immensely to goodwill and happy companionship. It is of great importance to the morale.
author: Elsa Schiaparelli

text: I feel very passionate about maintaining the same level of standard and respect for the food as an Iron Chef myself.
author: Alex Guarnaschelli

text: A man who has never made a woman angry is a failure in life.
author: Christopher Morley

text: It's what you learn after you know it all that counts.
author: John Wooden

text: I think the government should be out of the marriage business and leave marriage to the churches.
author: Gary Johnson

text: Begin to be now what you will be hereafter.
author: William James

text: Jesus is why women have traveled continents, spent decades learning a strange language so they could translate the Gospel, planting churches, caring for the sick, educating the illiterate, and marching for the oppressed.
author: John Ortberg

text: Failure is unimportant. It takes courage to make a fool of yourself.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: What can a pencil do for all of us? Amazing things. It can write transcendent poetry, uplifting music, or life-changing equations; it can sketch the future, give life to untold beauty, and communicate the full-force of our love and aspirations.
author: Adam Braun

text: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: I've tried to handle winning well, so that maybe we'll win again, but I've also tried to handle failure well. If those serve as good examples for teachers and kids, then I hope that would be a contribution I have made to sport. Not just basketball, but to sport.
author: Mike Krzyzewski

text: I think it was in 1971 or 1974, the Supreme Court ruled marriage is not a subject that the federal government can exercise jurisdiction over, including the courts. To do that, we would need an amendment to the Constitution.
author: Ken Cuccinelli

text: It's not someone else's responsibility to honor my marriage. It's my responsibility.
author: David Duchovny

text: You need a strong family because at the end, they will love you and support you unconditionally. Luckily, I have my dad, mom and sister.
author: Esha Gupta

text: Eating good food is my favourite thing in the whole world. Nothing is more blissful.
author: Justine Larbalestier

text: We teach about how to drive in school, but not how to manage finances.
author: Andy Williams

text: Marriage was never a destination with me.
author: Diane von Furstenberg

text: I went to work in accounting at Arthur Andersen. At one point, it was the creme de la creme. I wanted to work there because it looked like the hardest thing I could find, and I loved being on a steep learning curve. I progressed quickly, and two years out of college, I was managing a small team of people.
author: Lynn Good

text: By divine design, men and women are intended to progress together toward perfection and a fulness of glory. Because of their distinctive temperaments and capacities, males and females each bring to a marriage relationship unique perspectives and experiences.
author: David A. Bednar

text: Success is a science; if you have the conditions, you get the result.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: What the mass media offers is not popular art, but entertainment which is intended to be consumed like food, forgotten, and replaced by a new dish.
author: W. H. Auden

text: Don't be afraid of missing opportunities. Behind every failure is an opportunity somebody wishes they had missed.
author: Lily Tomlin

text: We must walk consciously only part way toward our goal, and then leap in the dark to our success.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Please all, and you will please none.
author: Aesop

text: Delivering a successful presentation could mean landing a major new contract, better prices for your services, or getting the funding you need. Failure can mean lost customers and a business that never gets off the ground.
author: Lewis Howes

text: Well, you know, I just - I believe marriage should between a man and a woman.
author: Victoria Osteen

text: In many ways, it was much, much harder to get the first book contract. The hardest thing probably overall has been learning not to trust people, publicists and so forth, implicitly.
author: Neil Gaiman

text: One man's trash is another man's treasure, and the by-product from one food can be perfect for making another.
author: Yotam Ottolenghi

text: Cross-cultural learning and studying abroad can be transformative.
author: Amal Clooney

text: A part of kindness consists in loving people more than they deserve.
author: Joseph Joubert

text: I believe all people, regardless of sexual orientation, should be guaranteed the full rights to the legal benefits and responsibilities of marriage under the Constitution.
author: Tim Kaine

text: All wars signify the failure of conflict resolution mechanisms, and they need post-war rebuilding of faith, trust and confidence.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

text: If you go back to the time of J.P. Morgan, the world of high finance was completely wholesale. The prestigious investment banks on Wall Street appealed exclusively to large corporations, governments, and to extremely wealthy individuals.
author: Ron Chernow

text: Above all, Danny Boyle's 'Slumdog Millionaire' is the work of an artist at the peak of his powers. India is his palette, and Mumbai - that teeming 'maximum city', with 19 million strivers on the make, jostling, scheming, struggling and killing for success - is his brush.
author: Shashi Tharoor

text: Falling in love consists merely in uncorking the imagination and bottling the common sense.
author: Helen Rowland

text: Marriage is... OK, it's rooted and grounded on love and attraction.
author: Mary Archer

text: I have great Indian genes! You know, I'm lazy. I want to take advantage of the fact that I have a great metabolism. When I start getting fat, I'll work on it! I like food, and I don't like the gym, and as long as I look like this without doing anything, why bother?
author: Priyanka Chopra

text: I know more about what it's like to be elderly and infirm and kind of stupid, the way you get forgetful, but on the other hand I'm a littler, wiser, dare we say? The word 'wisdom' has kind of faded out of our vocabulary, but yeah, I'm a little wiser.
author: John Updike

text: The debate over same sex 'marriage' has engaged the heartfelt feelings and convictions of millions of Americans.
author: Elliott Abrams

text: Earl Nightingale has inspired more people toward success and fortune than any other motivational speaker on the planet.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: The giving of love is an education in itself.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: While I thought that I was learning how to live, I have been learning how to die.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: In the stillness of your presence, you can feel your own formless and timeless reality as the unmanifested life that animates your physical form. You can then feel the same life deep within every other human and every other creature. You look beyond the veil of form and separation. This is the realization of oneness. This is love.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: Never let your head hang down. Never give up and sit down and grieve. Find another way. And don't pray when it rains if you don't pray when the sun shines.
author: Richard M. Nixon

text: I have yet to hear a man ask for advice on how to combine marriage and a career.
author: Gloria Steinem

text: When I was learning to creep, my mother set me down on the beach to see what I thought of it. I crawled straight for the coming wave and was just through the wall of green when she caught my heels.
author: Sylvia Plath

text: The success in the determination of the high-resolution structures of ribosomal subunits and eventually the whole ribosome was the culmination of decades of effort.
author: Venkatraman Ramakrishnan

text: In actuality, California could be a wonderful place to live. In fact, if you're highly educated and ambitious, you can do quite well here while enjoying the sun and the fun. The only problem: California will then blame you for your success and recommend that all your cash be removed from you.
author: Ben Shapiro

text: The expectations of life depend upon diligence; the mechanic that would perfect his work must first sharpen his tools.
author: Confucius

text: I don't get high, but sometimes I wish I did. That way, when I messed up in life I would have an excuse. But right now there's no rehab for stupidity.
author: Chris Rock

text: The role of the musician is to go from concept to full execution. Put another way, it's to go from understanding the content of something to really learning how to communicate it and make sure it's well-received and lives in somebody else.
author: Yo-Yo Ma

text: I'm just learning who I am and how relationships work and how to make them function. No different from anyone else.
author: Drew Barrymore

text: Marriage can be a magnificent lesson in becoming our best selves; that is true.
author: Marianne Williamson

text: Love is being stupid together.
author: Paul Valery

text: The moment you have in your heart this extraordinary thing called love and feel the depth, the delight, the ecstasy of it, you will discover that for you the world is transformed.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

text: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: If you are a lawyer, and you want to take on easier cases, you can prosecute traffic violations or something. You'd have a very high rate of success, and you probably could sleep more easily at night. But that's not what drives me.
author: Amal Clooney

text: President Bush once said that marriage is a sacred institution and should be reserved for the union of one man and one woman. If this is the case - and most Americans would agree with him on this - then I have to ask: Why is the government at all involved in marrying people?
author: Tony Campolo

text: Poverty was the greatest motivating factor in my life.
author: Jimmy Dean

text: If terrorists are already on our southern border, a national-security failure has already occurred.
author: Mike Pompeo

text: One of the main focuses of my training sessions is to help individuals find their unique voices in the learning process. We all have our strengths, our weaknesses, our styles of learning, our personalities. Developing introspective sensitivity to these issues is critical to long-term success.
author: Joshua Waitzkin

text: The foundation of success in life is good health: that is the substratum fortune; it is also the basis of happiness. A person cannot accumulate a fortune very well when he is sick.
author: P. T. Barnum

text: Success is only meaningful and enjoyable if it feels like your own.
author: Michelle Obama

text: I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter.
author: Walt Disney

text: I think what 'The Hobbit' and Middle-earth deal in are quite universal and timeless themes of honour and love and friendship... so they're things that do resonate with people.
author: Martin Freeman

text: As a parent and a citizen, I'll take a Bill Gates (or Warren Buffett) over Steve Jobs every time. If we must have billionaires, better they should ignore Jobs's example and instead embrace the morality and wisdom of the great industrialist-philanthropist Andrew Carnegie.
author: Eric Alterman

text: I am highly offended by the total lack of acknowledgement of my contribution to Laker success.
author: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar

text: Allowing myself to love God completely has obviously shed light on my self-love because he loves me more than I could ever love myself.
author: Angie Stone

text: I've never been a jealous person, and I've never felt built up by someone else's failure - that's a cheap thrill.
author: Matthew McConaughey

text: Do you remember any instance where tyranny was destroyed and freedom established on its ruins, among a people possessing so small a share of virtue and public spirit? I recollect none, and this more than the British arms makes me fearful of final success, without a reform.
author: Patrick Henry

text: Holy wisdom confounds Satan and all his wickednesses.
author: Francis of Assisi

text: Athol Fugard became famous as a playwright, so although 'Tsotsi' the book was written in the '60s, it was only published in the '80s. It was then optioned pretty much every year by producers. I think the problem was that holding onto its period setting made it very hard to get finance.
author: Gavin Hood

text: The first question which the priest and the Levite asked was: 'If I stop to help this man, what will happen to me?' But... the good Samaritan reversed the question: 'If I do not stop to help this man, what will happen to him?'
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: As I'm getting older, I'm really learning unconditional love and loyalty are extremely important.
author: Bindi Irwin

text: The cure for all the ills and wrongs, the cares, the sorrows, and the crimes of humanity, all lie in the one word 'love'. It is the divine vitality that everywhere produces and restores life.
author: Lydia M. Child

text: The happiest moment of my life was probably when my daughter was born.
author: David Duchovny

text: Learning is any change in a system that produces a more or less permanent change in its capacity for adapting to its environment.
author: Herbert Simon

text: I don't love studying. I hate studying. I like learning. Learning is beautiful.
author: Natalie Portman

text: Marriage is gonna be your stability through everything.
author: Miranda Lambert

text: Riding a bicycle is the summit of human endeavour - an almost neutral environmental effect coupled with the ability to travel substantial distances without disturbing anybody. The bike is the perfect marriage of technology and human energy.
author: Jeremy Corbyn

text: Life is one big road with lots of signs. So when you riding through the ruts, don't complicate your mind. Flee from hate, mischief and jealousy. Don't bury your thoughts, put your vision to reality. Wake Up and Live!
author: Bob Marley

text: In July of 2010, I lost my finance job in Chicago. Instead of updating my resume and looking for a similar job, I decided to forget about money and have a go at something I truly enjoyed. I'd purchased a semi-professional camera earlier that year and spent my free time taking photos in downtown Chicago.
author: Brandon Stanton

text: When Arnold Schwarzenegger vetoed the same-sex marriage bill, my blood was boiling. I had been silent, but that night, Brad and I watched the news and saw all these young people pouring out on Santa Monica Boulevard venting their rage, and I said, 'I have to speak out.'
author: George Takei

text: My children have been learning lessons about entrepreneurship since they were in kindergarten, and these lessons are paying off: even though they are only 22, 18, and 15, they have already collectively launched three nonprofit organizations and several new businesses.
author: Naveen Jain

text: Problems or successes, they all are the results of our own actions. Karma. The philosophy of action is that no one else is the giver of peace or happiness. One's own karma, one's own actions are responsible to come to bring either happiness or success or whatever.
author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi

text: I never learned from a man who agreed with me.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

text: Learning from wolves to interact with pet dogs makes about as much sense as, 'I want to improve my parenting - let's see how the chimps do it!'
author: Ian Dunbar

text: We've taken the view that if the rest of the world would democratize and create market economies, that would spread the benefits of prosperity around the world, and that it would enhance our own prosperity, and our own stability and security, as well.
author: Jeffrey Sachs

text: Sympathy constitutes friendship; but in love there is a sort of antipathy, or opposing passion. Each strives to be the other, and both together make up one whole.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

text: I don't find it a struggle to maintain a healthy diet now as my palate has changed. I don't crave rich food.
author: Jennifer Ellison

text: Just ask the local people for the best food. Don't rely on a guidebook.
author: Masaharu Morimoto

text: The female of the genus homo is economically dependent on the male. He is her food supply.
author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman

text: There is an amazing power getting to know your inner self and learning how to use it and not fight with the world. If you know what makes you happy, your personality, interests and capabilities, just use them, and everything else flows beautifully.
author: Juhi Chawla

text: I believe we have become paralyzed, paralyzed by our desire to be loved. Now our founding fathers had the wisdom to know that social acceptance and popularity were fleeing, and that this country's principles needed to be rooted in strengths greater than the passions and the emotions of the times.
author: Chris Christie

text: Because of media hype and woefully inadequate information, too many people nowadays are deathly afraid of their food, and what does fear of food do to the digestive system? I am sure that an unhappy or suspicious stomach, constricted and uneasy with worry, cannot digest properly.
author: Julia Child

text: Life isn't about algebra and geometry. Learning by making mistakes and not duplicating them is what life is about.
author: Lindsay Fox

text: Without industry, finance and government consciously and collaboratively ensuring that capital flows to where it is needed in order to ensure the scaling up of climate change solutions, whatever deal is agreed risks never being realised.
author: Noreena Hertz

text: The most I can do for my friend is simply be his friend.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: In God's world, for those who are in earnest, there is no failure. No work truly done, no word earnestly spoken, no sacrifice freely made, was ever made in vain.
author: Frederick William Robertson

text: Learning to love my inner and outer beauty wasn't an easy road. I still don't always love the reflection I see in the mirror, but I have learned that my outer appearance does not define me.
author: Katherine Schwarzenegger

text: Failure means a stripping away of the inessential.
author: J. K. Rowling

text: One of the things, one of the things that really got to me was the thing in Houston where you had the government, the mayor actually, trying to get the sermons of ministers. When the government tries to invade the church to enforce its own opinion on marriage, that's when it's time to resist.
author: Rand Paul

text: We're learning a tremendous amount of propaganda from television and the Internet.
author: James McBride

text: I always made my food congenial to my constitution, and my health was always excellent.
author: Giacomo Casanova

text: Believe me, I understand the need for easy and speedy. After a 12-hour day of shooting 'Chopped,' say, I'm talking stir-fry, spaghetti, heck, peanut-butter sandwiches. But that's not about the joy of food. That's survival.
author: Ted Allen

text: We climb to heaven most often on the ruins of our cherished plans, finding our failures were successes.
author: Amos Bronson Alcott

text: The love of family and the admiration of friends is much more important than wealth and privilege.
author: Charles Kuralt

text: If you are not too long, I will wait here for you all my life.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Love is like a friendship caught on fire. In the beginning a flame, very pretty, often hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. As love grows older, our hearts mature and our love becomes as coals, deep-burning and unquenchable.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Yeah, I miss it. You don't just break off a friendship you've had with a sport, and with all those you've met all over the country. We've got some friends, some very close friends, and you just sit back and think how fortunate you were having a career like that. And, actually, there's nothing in the game of baseball that hasn't happened to me.
author: Lou Boudreau

text: I still think it's essential for a parent to cook with their children. Weighing out the ingredients and learning where the food comes from is educational, but it also helps to place meal times at the heart of family life. We never had dinner in front of the TV.
author: Mary Berry

text: Once you get a spice in your home, you have it forever. Women never throw out spices. The Egyptians were buried with their spices. I know which one I'm taking with me when I go.
author: Erma Bombeck

text: There is failure in every industry; there is failure in every step. It's just that we are working in an industry where everything is just out there; that is why it looks so magnified. But failure is a part of life.
author: Yami Gautam

text: Follow your heart. Do what you love. Because I was constantly struggling with that. If it's in your heart, go for it. Don't listen to other people.
author: Maz Jobrani

text: Love is always being given where it is not required.
author: E. M. Forster

text: Nothing that has value, real value, has no cost. Not freedom, not food, not shelter, not healthcare.
author: Dean Kamen

text: I don't believe you have to be better than everybody else. I believe you have to be better than you ever thought you could be.
author: Ken Venturi

text: Life isn't black and white. It's a million gray areas, don't you find?
author: Ridley Scott

text: Being part of the Workshop is like being part of a really big family. Everyone is so close. Everyone feels the success of others who go on to do well. Whatever happens, I will still be part of the Workshop.
author: Lucy Carless

text: Love without conversation is impossible.
author: Mortimer Adler

text: Friendship often ends in love, but love in friendship - never.
author: Albert Camus

text: Achievement is not always success, while reputed failure often is. It is honest endeavor, persistent effort to do the best possible under any and all circumstances.
author: Orison Swett Marden

text: I've found that luck is quite predictable. If you want more luck, take more chances. Be more active. Show up more often.
author: Brian Tracy

text: I have probably purchased fifty 'hot tips' in my career, maybe even more. When I put them all together, I know I am a net loser.
author: Charles Schwab

text: When I was growing up, Brandy was TV star, reality star, a pop star, a Cover girl, Grammy winner, had her own Brandy doll, and was the first African American to play Disney princess Cinderella. Most importantly, she is a survivor. Many only judge and remember a person's most recent failure.
author: Niecy Nash

text: By the time you've reached your sixties, you do know that one day you will die, and knowing that is at least the beginning of wisdom.
author: Terry Pratchett

text: I train and I go home, and when I'm home, I think about training. That's my life every day, and that's it.
author: Conor McGregor

text: You never stop learning. If you have a teacher, you never stop being a student.
author: Elisabeth Rohm

text: Love who you are, embrace who you are. Love yourself. When you love yourself, people can kind of pick up on that: they can see confidence, they can see self-esteem, and naturally, people gravitate towards you.
author: Lilly Singh

text: We are what our thoughts have made us; so take care about what you think. Words are secondary. Thoughts live; they travel far.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: With me, what you see is what you get. Yes, call me naive, but I love life. I am happy, and for that, I make no apologies. I do like to see the best in people, and when someone is nice to my face, I tend to believe them.
author: Joyce Giraud

text: There is, hidden or flaunted, a sword between the sexes till an entire marriage reconciles them.
author: C. S. Lewis

text: On YouTube, when you have a big viral success with a song that isn't your own, the natural inclination for most YouTubers is to keep doing that. What you really should do is show people that you actually have substance and can write your own music.
author: Charlie Puth

text: Not a single illegal immigrant should or need enter the United States, not one. Contrary to the common wisdom, the borders are easy to seal, and controlling entry is hardly totalitarian.
author: Mark Helprin

text: All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence, and then success is sure.
author: Mark Twain

text: It's better to be a lion for a day than a sheep all your life.
author: Elizabeth Kenny

text: Love yourself. It is important to stay positive because beauty comes from the inside out.
author: Jenn Proske

text: The Indian Summer of life should be a little sunny and a little sad, like the season, and infinite in wealth and depth of tone, but never hustled.
author: Henry Adams

text: Life is full of beauty. Notice it. Notice the bumble bee, the small child, and the smiling faces. Smell the rain, and feel the wind. Live your life to the fullest potential, and fight for your dreams.
author: Ashley Smith

text: I think happiness is a choice. If you feel yourself being happy and can settle in to the life choices you make, then it's great. It's really, really great. I swear to God, happiness is the best makeup.
author: Drew Barrymore

text: A person who doubts himself is like a man who would enlist in the ranks of his enemies and bear arms against himself. He makes his failure certain by himself being the first person to be convinced of it.
author: Alexandre Dumas

text: Life is all about the friendship and the love and the music. It sounds silly, but it is. I want to have that experience as much as I can as an adult, not as a kid doing something that people are telling her she has to do. If anyone gets in my way, I'm going to get them out of my way.
author: Fiona Apple

text: If you don't want women to do whatever they need to do then you must provide them with food, you must provide them with shelter and their basic human rights.
author: Emma Thompson

text: The wisdom of the wise and the experience of the ages is preserved into perpetuity by a nation's proverbs, fables, folk sayings and quotations.
author: William Feather

text: A dog will teach you unconditional love. If you can have that in your life, things won't be too bad.
author: Robert Wagner

text: I wish that the Indians believed me a god, for upon the report of an enemy's valor oftentimes depends the success of a battle, and false reports have many times done as great things as true courage and resolution.
author: Alexander the Great

text: Success is the only motivational factor that a boy with character needs.
author: Woody Hayes

text: I didn't have any Indigenous friends until I was in my 30s, and I'll always remember and be inspired by the remarkable friendship I had with Connie Bush, an outstanding Indigenous leader from Groot Eylandt on who was on the National Women's Advisory Council with me.
author: Quentin Bryce

text: Mindfulness is about love and loving life. When you cultivate this love, it gives you clarity and compassion for life, and your actions happen in accordance with that.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

text: Memory is the mother of all wisdom.
author: Aeschylus

text: You know, real life doesn't just suddenly resolve itself. You have to keep working at it. Democracy, marriage, friendship. You can't just say, 'She's my best friend.' That's not a given, it's a process.
author: Viggo Mortensen

text: I'm big on tomato mozzarella salad. That's my favorite all-time food.
author: Jan Fields

text: When I was an actor, I worked with lots of men who had a bit of success early on, who were very good looking, who suddenly made a bit of money and who felt no embarrassment - and nor should they have done - about having a good time.
author: David Nicholls

text: Learn from the past, set vivid, detailed goals for the future, and live in the only moment of time over which you have any control: now.
author: Denis Waitley

text: Everyone who achieves success in a great venture, solves each problem as they came to it. They helped themselves. And they were helped through powers known and unknown to them at the time they set out on their voyage. They keep going regardless of the obstacles they met.
author: W. Clement Stone

text: To do a common thing uncommonly well brings success.
author: Henry J. Heinz

text: Do not let your ambitions become a sanctuary for your failures.
author: Bryant H. McGill

text: Successful weight management really means a permanent change in lifestyle - and success in this arena provides that person with a great opportunity to model that behavior for friends and family.
author: Francis Collins

text: I believe in trusting men, not only once but twice - in giving a failure another chance.
author: James Cash Penney

text: I am always doing that which I cannot do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Life teaches you that you need to make decisions in the right time - not too early, not too late.
author: Jeb Bush

text: I don't care how handsome or fabulous or funny the groom is, or how sweet and accommodating the bride, or vice versa. Marriage is hard.
author: Jenna McCarthy

text: Love is the beauty of the soul.
author: Saint Augustine

text: I don't dwell on success. Maybe that's one reason I'm successful.
author: Calvin Klein

text: In fact, corporate and union moneys go overwhelmingly to incumbents, so limiting that money, as Congress did in the campaign finance law, may be the single most self-denying thing that Congress has ever done.
author: Elena Kagan

text: An arrogant person considers himself perfect. This is the chief harm of arrogance. It interferes with a person's main task in life - becoming a better person.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: My most difficult class at Harvard Business School would have to be finance.
author: Tyra Banks

text: I took all my TV experience and what I learned about - by writing and directing and bringing a movie to Sundance - about the realities of the independent film market: 'Transparent' is the marriage of those two situations.
author: Jill Soloway

text: I believe that if you don't derive a deep sense of purpose from what you do, if you don't come radiantly alive several times a day, if you don't feel deeply grateful at the tremendous good fortune that has been bestowed on you, then you are wasting your life. And life is too short to waste.
author: Srikumar Rao

text: Failure is success if we learn from it.
author: Malcolm Forbes

text: We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love.
author: Tom Robbins

text: As long as you live, keep learning how to live.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

text: The story of a passionate woman in a stale marriage is as old as Helen of Troy.
author: G. Willow Wilson

text: Love is rarer than genius itself. And friendship is rarer than love.
author: Charles Peguy

text: Love comes unseen; we only see it go.
author: Henry Austin Dobson

text: I'm into very colorful food. Obviously lots of flavor, but I think we eat with our eyes first, so it has to look great. The presentation has to be great.
author: Giada De Laurentiis

text: Love is flower like; Friendship is like a sheltering tree.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

text: I have become a subscriber for 'Business Week.' It teaches me a lot about business, and I have really started to get into it. I'm interested in business and learning about how everything works.
author: Marko Jaric

text: I love a man with a great sense of humor and who is intelligent - a man who has a great smile. He has to make me laugh. I like a man who is very ambitious and driven and who has a good heart and makes me feel safe. I like a man who is very strong and independent and confident - that is very sexy - but at the same time, he's very kind to people.
author: Nicole Scherzinger

text: By seeing London, I have seen as much of life as the world can show.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: As educators, we are only as effective as what we know. If we have no working knowledge of what students studied in previous years, how can we build on their learning? If we have no insight into the curriculum in later grades, how can we prepare learners for future classes?
author: Heidi Hayes Jacobs

text: I'm quite obsessed with the idea of nailing the girl friendship. It's such an art, so delicate.
author: Alanis Morissette

text: Jobs for every American is doomed to failure because of modern automation and production. We ought to recognize it and create an income-maintenance system so every single American has the dignity and the wherewithal for shelter, basic food, and medical care. I'm talking about welfare for all. Without it, you're going to have warfare for all.
author: Jerry Brown

text: Of prosperity mortals can never have enough.
author: Aeschylus

text: I don't take success and failure seriously. The only thing I do seriously is march forward. If I fall, I get up and march again.
author: Kareena Kapoor Khan

text: I keep my friends as misers do their treasure, because, of all the things granted us by wisdom, none is greater or better than friendship.
author: Pietro Aretino

text: Don't give up. Don't lose hope. Don't sell out.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: If you're constantly pushing yourself higher, higher, the law of averages - not to mention the myth of Icarus - predicts that you will at some point fall. And when you do, I want you to know this, remember this: There is no such thing as failure.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Coming to terms with the fact that my marriage was a failure was devastating and very difficult. I blamed myself for a lot of things. It took me a very long time to get over it.
author: Sarah McLachlan

text: Campaign finance and ethics reform only works if it curtails all special interest groups equally and does not carve out any exceptions to benefit one party or another. 'Pay to play' reform was passed to limit the influence of big spending contractors over the public officials from whom they are trying to obtain work.
author: Thomas Kean, Jr.

text: Only do what your heart tells you.
author: Princess Diana

text: If we're destroying our trees and destroying our environment and hurting animals and hurting one another and all that stuff, there's got to be a very powerful energy to fight that. I think we need more love in the world. We need more kindness, more compassion, more joy, more laughter. I definitely want to contribute to that.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

text: What distinguishes the campaign finance issue from just about every other one being debated these days is that the two sides do not divide along conventional liberal/ conservative lines.
author: James L. Buckley

text: It's cool to have critical success because it's always nice for your peers to say, 'Good job.' But who cares about them?
author: Zac Hanson

text: My love for ice cream emerged at an early age - and has never left!
author: Ginger Rogers

text: A 10-pound sack of potatoes lasts a long time.
author: Octavia E. Butler

text: Never stop fighting until you arrive at your destined place - that is, the unique you. Have an aim in life, continuously acquire knowledge, work hard, and have perseverance to realise the great life.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

text: Reading is an exercise for learning how to write and vice versa. I have read myself into being a Christian, but I have also written myself into being a Christian.
author: Stanley Hauerwas

text: In the face of love, everyone is equal. Let everyone have the freedom to love and to pursue their happiness. I am Tsai Ing-wen, and I support marriage equality.
author: Tsai Ing-wen

text: Success is 99 percent failure.
author: Soichiro Honda

text: Be willing to step outside your comfort zone once in a while; take the risks in life that seem worth taking. The ride might not be as predictable if you'd just planted your feet and stayed put, but it will be a heck of a lot more interesting.
author: Edward Whitacre, Jr.

text: The clearest explanation for the failure of any marriage is that the two people are incompatible; that is, that one is male and the other female.
author: Anna Quindlen

text: Chicken fat, beef fat, fish fat, fried foods - these are the foods that fuel our fat genes by giving them raw materials for building body fat.
author: Neal Barnard

text: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
author: Henry Ford

text: Yes, I am seeking a husband. As soon as the right man asks me, I shall say, 'It is not good for a woman to live alone.'
author: Anna Held

text: We respect our elders. There is wisdom that comes from experience, and I am not going to stop learning from wise counsel.
author: Marcia Fudge

text: Be strong, believe in freedom and in God, love yourself, understand your sexuality, have a sense of humor, masturbate, don't judge people by their religion, color or sexual habits, love life and your family.
author: Madonna Ciccone

text: Of course I dream to have this perfect man who does not want to change me. And I'm so not marriage material, it's terrible. But my dream is to have those Sunday mornings, where you're eating breakfast and reading newspapers with somebody.
author: Marina Abromovic

text: Throughout its history, the international Olympic Committee has struggled to spread its ideal of fraternity, friendship, peace and universal understanding.
author: Juan Antonio Samaranch

text: Failure is always an option.
author: Adam Savage

text: Scotch beef, salmon and shellfish are recognised the world over for their excellence and Scottish provenance. People recognise the Scottish brand. They associate the country with quality food and drink, and clearly other Scottish sectors, such as dairy, can benefit from that, too.
author: Nicola Sturgeon

text: There are a lot of musicians I've met on Twitter where it was like, 'Hey, I like your music' - and then I ended up meeting them and it turned into a friendship.
author: Grimes

text: Success is the sweetest revenge.
author: Vanessa Williams

text: No man can be a failure if he thinks he's a success; If he thinks he is a winner, then he is.
author: Robert W. Service

text: Our bodies are at once the receiving and transmitting stations for life itself. It is the highest wisdom to recognize this fact and train our bodies to render them sensitive and responsive to nature. art and religion.
author: Ruth St. Denis

text: Women's strength, women's industry, women's wisdom are humankind's greatest untapped resource. The challenge then for U.N. Women is to show our diverse constituencies how this resource can be effectively tapped in ways that benefit us all.
author: Michelle Bachelet

text: Without any formal personal finance education or trustworthy resources to tell them otherwise, the majority of people in the 18-to-24-year-old age bracket do not know how to use credit effectively, tackle debt or make wise decisions when it comes to spending.
author: Alexa Von Tobel

text: Second, this epic tale allows the audience to actually listen to the Native Americans and receive their wisdom. Spielberg conveys the respect for Native Americans that is normally lacking in Western films.
author: Beau Bridges

text: In school, we learn that mistakes translate into bad grades. This unfortunate lesson gets burned into our brains, and we go through life shunning challenges that might end in failure.
author: Mark Frauenfelder

text: Oh, I would love to be a motivational speaker. I have pulled myself out of a million potholes, and I can see the potholes ahead of me. That doesn't mean that I could always do that so perfectly for my own life. I totally fall in potholes.
author: Drew Barrymore

text: I'd rather learn from one bird how to sing than teach ten thousand stars how not to dance.
author: e. e. cummings

text: Success depends upon previous preparation, and without such preparation there is sure to be failure.
author: Confucius

text: I sacrificed a lot, in terms of friendship and family, from working so much at such a young age, but I wouldn't be where I am if I hadn't.
author: Sasha Grey

text: Everything you need for better future and success has already been written. And guess what? All you have to do is go to the library.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

text: I didn't like England. I couldn't take the look of the place or the style of friendship. I need more intimacy from people than is considered okay there, and I felt that my personality and my enthusiasms weren't understood. I had to put a big lid on myself.
author: Jane Campion

text: Different parts of the world have different attitudes to failure. Arguably, it may take more courage to be an entrepreneur in Sydney, or Paris, or London, or Japan, or Singapore... but an entrepreneur sees the world for what it could be, not what it is.
author: Guy Kawasaki

text: Tragedy is a tool for the living to gain wisdom, not a guide by which to live.
author: Robert Kennedy

text: Once our country is fully engulfed in a debt crisis, our economy will be torn apart, and every American will be a victim of the federal government's failure to prevent this disaster.
author: Kevin McCarthy

text: I've always believed in a rainbow diet. As many colors and foods as you can eat, the better, because if you focus on one food, there's bound to be a report that comes out that says, 'Broccoli actually... ' So I mix it up a lot. And I take vitamins, like Biosil, which I take for my hair, skin, and nails.
author: Christie Brinkley

text: There is no life to be found in violence. Every act of violence brings us closer to death. Whether it's the mundane violence we do to our bodies by overeating toxic food or drink or the extreme violence of child abuse, domestic warfare, life-threatening poverty, addiction, or state terrorism.
author: bell hooks

text: Sometimes life hits you in the head with a brick. Don't lose faith.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Politics doesn't make strange bedfellows - marriage does.
author: Groucho Marx

text: When I was nine, the teacher asked us to write a piece about our village fete. He read mine in class. I was encouraged and continued. I even wanted to write my memoirs at the age of ten. At twelve I wrote poetry, mostly about friendship - 'Ode to Friendship.' Then my class wanted to make a film, and one little boy suggested that I write the script.
author: Eugene Ionesco

text: By the time I was a young man, I lived with two deep struggles: I longed to become a cricketer, and I performed miserably in school. Cricket and tennis were all that I lived for. In India, this was a formula for failure.
author: Ravi Zacharias

text: The way we finance homes in this country is slow, filled with middlemen, who run a nonstandardized evaluation process. This makes financing a home cumbersome and difficult.
author: Barry Ritholtz

text: Remember what Susan B. Anthony said? 'Failure is impossible.' Failure is possible if women don't vote.
author: Madeleine M. Kunin

text: Your attitude will go a long way in determining your success, your recognition, your reputation and your enjoyment in being a lawyer.
author: Joe Jamail

text: Mixing one's wines may be a mistake, but old and new wisdom mix admirably.
author: Bertolt Brecht

text: Emotional 'literacy' implies an expanded responsibility for schools in helping to socialize children. This daunting task requires two major changes: that teachers go beyond their traditional mission and that people in the community become more involved with schools as both active participants in children's learning and as individual mentors.
author: Daniel Goleman

text: All theory, dear friend, is gray, but the golden tree of life springs ever green.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: It's the thing I struggle with every day: the mental diligence and stamina needed to sit in front of the computer, open the file, start writing and to keep doing so, word after word, until I've created the next story. A combination of learning disability and chronic health issues make that the hardest thing for me.
author: Nalo Hopkinson

text: If I had learned more about business ahead of time, I would have been shaped into believing that it was only about finances and quality management.
author: Anita Roddick

text: I don't believe people are looking for the meaning of life as much as they are looking for the experience of being alive.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: Humans have changed ecosystems more rapidly and extensively than in any comparable period of time in human history, largely to meet rapidly growing demands for food, fresh water, timber, fiber and fuel. This has resulted in a substantial and largely irreversible loss in the diversity of life on Earth.
author: Gary Larson

text: She has been more than a mother than me - not much, but definitely more... She's been an unsolicited stylist, interior decorator and marriage counselor... Admittedly, I found it difficult to share my mother with her adoring fans, who treated her like she was part of their family.
author: Carrie Fisher

text: Ultimately, all human activities have as their goal the realization of happiness. Why, then, have we ended up producing the opposite result? Could the underlying cause be our failure to correctly understand the true nature of happiness?
author: Daisaku Ikeda

text: Marriage equality changed life for people.
author: Andrew Cuomo

text: Success in business today requires real-time, mobile access to business opportunities.
author: Bob McDonnell

text: If a man walks in the woods for love of them half of each day, he is in danger of being regarded as a loafer. But if he spends his days as a speculator, shearing off those woods and making the earth bald before her time, he is deemed an industrious and enterprising citizen.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Life is too short to worry about anything. You had better enjoy it because the next day promises nothing.
author: Eric Davis

text: The rise of Breitbart is directly tied to being the voice of that center-right opposition. And, quite frankly, we're winning many, many victories. On the social conservative side, we're the voice of the anti-abortion movement, the voice of the traditional marriage movement, and I can tell you we're winning victory after victory after victory.
author: Stephen Bannon

text: Fortunately analysis is not the only way to resolve inner conflicts. Life itself still remains a very effective therapist.
author: Karen Horney

text: You get so afraid of failure and so afraid of losing and so afraid of not being the best that it's not a natural drive - it's born out of fear of failure. Which helps in Hollywood.
author: Gabrielle Union

text: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
author: Lord Byron

text: There is only one happiness in this life, to love and be loved.
author: George Sand

text: The only real progress lies in learning to be wrong all alone.
author: Albert Camus

text: Before success comes in any man's life, he's sure to meet with much temporary defeat and, perhaps some failures. When defeat overtakes a man, the easiest and the most logical thing to do is to quit. That's exactly what the majority of men do.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: When you learn a Bruce Springsteen song, it's like learning to ride a bike. You don't forget it.
author: Clarence Clemons

text: Have regular hours for work and play; make each day both useful and pleasant, and prove that you understand the worth of time by employing it well. Then youth will be delightful, old age will bring few regrets, and life will become a beautiful success.
author: Louisa May Alcott

text: What can a pencil do for all of us? Amazing things. It can write transcendent poetry, uplifting music, or life-changing equations; it can sketch the future, give life to untold beauty, and communicate the full-force of our love and aspirations.
author: Adam Braun

text: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Success breeds success.
author: Mia Hamm

text: For every failure, there's an alternative course of action. You just have to find it. When you come to a roadblock, take a detour.
author: Mary Kay Ash

text: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
author: Socrates

text: Beware the hobby that eats.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Success took me to her bosom like a maternal boa constrictor.
author: Noel Coward

text: When I started learning the cello, I fell in love with the instrument because it seemed like a voice - my voice.
author: Mstislav Rostropovich

text: I like L.A. It's like a mini break. For a writer, it's hilarious. Like the food. Where I come from, we eat chip sandwiches: white bread, butter, tomato catsup and big fat french fries. It's delicious. Here, you order a creme caramel and the waiter says, 'You know, that contains dairy.'
author: Helen Fielding

text: If I could only have one type of food with me, I would bring soy sauce. The reason being that if I have soy sauce, I can flavor a lot of things.
author: Martin Yan

text: Nobody gets to live life backward. Look ahead, that is where your future lies.
author: Ann Landers

text: It's quite difficult to write about female friendship without it seeming to be a very niche subject. It's a difficult balance.
author: Samantha Harvey

text: Love of learning led to monasteries, which became the cradle of academic guilds.
author: John Ortberg

text: I think people are free to marry any way they want to. But churches are free to set standards for marriage.
author: Jeff Sessions

text: Masood Ahmed brings to the position of director of external relations extensive experience gained in a range of senior positions in international finance and development.
author: Rodrigo Rato

text: In the 21st century our tastes buds, our brain chemistry, our biochemistry, our hormones and our kitchens have been hijacked by the food industry.
author: Mark Hyman

text: When preaching is done right, it can change lives. When it's done badly, my failure goes beyond the merely human.
author: John Ortberg

text: Most success springs from an obstacle or failure. I became a cartoonist largely because I failed in my goal of becoming a successful executive.
author: Scott Adams

text: We should have a path to legal status for the 12 million people that are here illegally. It means, come out from the shadows, pay a fine, earn legal status by working, by paying taxes, learning English. Not committing crimes and earn legal status where you're not cutting in front of the line for people that are patiently waiting outside.
author: Jeb Bush

text: When I meet with the founders of a new company, my advice is almost always, 'Do fewer things.' It's true of partnerships, marketing opportunities, anything that's taking up your time. The vast majority of things are distractions, and very few really matter to your success.
author: Evan Williams

text: I love the sea's sounds and the way it reflects the sky. The colours that shimmer across its surface are unbelievable. This, combined with the colour of the water over white sand, surprises me every time.
author: John Dyer

text: The only reason I got married in 2003 was for my children. I had a therapist who said marriage is really a container for a family, and that made sense to me.
author: Julianne Moore

text: When the bank asks me about my assets, I include my friendship with Regis Philbin.
author: Lou Holtz

text: My friends are my estate.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: My father said there were two kinds of people in the world: givers and takers. The takers may eat better, but the givers sleep better.
author: Marlo Thomas

text: Someday, after mastering the winds, the waves, the tides and gravity, we shall harness for God the energies of love, and then, for a second time in the history of the world, man will have discovered fire.
author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

text: A passion for politics stems usually from an insatiable need, either for power, or for friendship and adulation, or a combination of both.
author: Fawn M. Brodie

text: My work ethic came from my parents and my fear of failure. I came from a small, predominantly black school and I didn't want to let them down.
author: Jerry Rice

text: We learn wisdom from failure much more than from success. We often discover what will do, by finding out what will not do; and probably he who never made a mistake never made a discovery.
author: Samuel Smiles

text: I had a marriage that I came to in the same way everybody else comes to a marriage. We all take chances when we get married.
author: Alec Baldwin

text: Love is the triumph of imagination over intelligence.
author: H. L. Mencken

text: I am an enthusiast, but not a crank in the sense that I have some pet theories as to the proper construction of a flying machine. I wish to avail myself of all that is already known and then, if possible, add my mite to help on the future worker who will attain final success.
author: Wilbur Wright

text: Start with what is right rather than what is acceptable.
author: Franz Kafka

text: Sometimes we may ask God for success, and He gives us physical and mental stamina. We might plead for prosperity, and we receive enlarged perspective and increased patience, or we petition for growth and are blessed with the gift of grace. He may bestow upon us conviction and confidence as we strive to achieve worthy goals.
author: David A. Bednar

text: Success is what you do with your ability. It's how you use your talent.
author: George Allen, Sr.

text: Now our founding fathers had the wisdom to know that social acceptance and popularity were fleeing, and that this country's principles needed to be rooted in strengths greater than the passions and the emotions of the times.
author: Chris Christie

text: My story as an artist has been about trial and error. It's been about artist development, character building, struggle, happiness and failure, family, and music.
author: Anderson Paak

text: Appetite, craving for food, is a constant and powerful stimulator of the gastric glands.
author: Ivan Pavlov

text: I love dress shopping, and I love talking about the wedding food. That's what makes me happy. If you tell me to do a guest list, I cry. I hate it.
author: Chrissy Teigen

text: There are pockets of great food in Spain, but there are also pockets of very mediocre food in Spain, and the same in Morocco and the same in Croatia and the same in Germany and the same in Austria.
author: Mario Batali

text: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them - that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.
author: Lao Tzu

text: When people say they prefer organic food, what they often seem to mean is they don't want their food tainted with pesticides and their meat shot full of hormones or antibiotics. Many object to the way a few companies - Monsanto is the most famous of them - control so many of the seeds we grow.
author: Michael Specter

text: 'Catch-22' was a huge failure, and it rubbed off on everybody connected to it. I had a bunch of lean years where I had to do things, a lot of which I wasn't wildly enthusiastic about.
author: Alan Arkin

text: Love ceases to be a pleasure when it ceases to be a secret.
author: Aphra Behn

text: Silences make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying but the never needing to say is what counts.
author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

text: Most people stop learning out of fear. They are afraid they cannot learn.
author: Henry B. Eyring

text: I ran to my marriage, I was happily ready to take on marriage.
author: Mark Ruffalo

text: There are only three things women need in life: food, water, and compliments.
author: Chris Rock

text: In my public service, I treasure my friendship with law enforcement officers. I admire what they do and support them in every aspect of their job. I have always looked upon law enforcement officers as my friends.
author: Dirk Kempthorne

text: I love making new friends and I respect people for a lot of different reasons.
author: Taylor Swift

text: Marriage must be a relation either of sympathy or of conquest.
author: George Eliot

text: The failure of the White House and Congress to seriously address the nation's fiscal situation is certain to broaden the belief among many voters that the U.S. political system is broken.
author: Ron Fournier

text: In the United States, I am a great success, but I am not a celebrity.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Every friendship is different because everyone's personality is different.
author: Nargis Fakhri

text: We didn't know that Mother had gone through a passionate love affair or that Father suffered from severe depression. Mother was preparing to break out of her marriage, Father threatening to take his own life.
author: Ingmar Bergman

text: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other.
author: Walter Elliot

text: I don't plan on going back to legal work. I wanted an international career, and finance seemed to be where some interesting career opportunities were.
author: Nick Johnson

text: A person will sometimes devote all his life to the development of one part of his body - the wishbone.
author: Robert Frost

text: Sometimes the heart sees what is invisible to the eye.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

text: I started doing motivational tours. I've seen all kinds of people, from the CEOs to the lowest executive, opening up to their fears. We don't introspect as much as we should.
author: Anupam Kher

text: We've got this gift of love, but love is like a precious plant. You can't just accept it and leave it in the cupboard or just think it's going to get on by itself. You've got to keep watering it. You've got to really look after it and nurture it.
author: John Lennon

text: During the Arab Spring, I learned all sorts of things from Twitter. I wouldn't necessarily trust that information, but it gave me ideas about questions to ask. You can really learn things from the wisdom of crowds.
author: Nicholas Kristof

text: I love when people underestimate me and then become pleasantly surprised.
author: Kim Kardashian

text: Only by learning to live in harmony with your contradictions can you keep it all afloat.
author: Audre Lorde

text: I know I'm likeable, but living with me is different. Yes, I can be charming. That desire to please people and learning what to do to charm their socks off is something many of us do. But you get into a relationship, and the party's over at some point. They see the real you.
author: John Grant

text: Life isn't always really glamorous and fabulous. It's about encouraging people to go back to natural beauty.
author: Zoe Foster Blake

text: Any critic is entitled to wrong judgments, of course. But certain lapses of judgment indicate the radical failure of an entire sensibility.
author: Susan Sontag

text: Avoid having your ego so close to your position that when your position falls, your ego goes with it.
author: Colin Powell

text: A mouse does not rely on just one hole.
author: Plautus

text: First and foremost, the monk should own nothing in this world, but he should have as his possessions solitude of the body, modesty of bearing, a modulated tone of voice, and a well-ordered manner of speech. He should be without anxiety as to his food and drink, and should eat in silence.
author: Saint Basil

text: I look at where I'm at today and realize that most of my success is owed to the mentors that was in my life.
author: Kendrick Lamar

text: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
author: Ayn Rand

text: For prayer is nothing else than being on terms of friendship with God.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

text: A man should always consider how much he has more than he wants.
author: Joseph Addison

text: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece, make friendship a fine art, drink deeply from good books - especially the Bible, build a shelter against a rainy day, give thanks for your blessings and pray for guidance every day.
author: John Wooden

text: Good friends, good books and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life.
author: Mark Twain

text: I love my wife and I know she loves me. We're best friends. We're just lucky to have found each other. It takes a lot of work but I just feel very blessed that I found the right person. It's a very fortunate situation and not everyone has that.
author: Harry Connick, Jr.

text: A man is already halfway in love with any woman who listens to him.
author: Brendan Behan

text: Anything that won't sell, I don't want to invent. Its sale is proof of utility, and utility is success.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: If God did not intend for us to eat animals, then why did he make them out of meat?
author: John Cleese

text: A short saying often contains much wisdom.
author: Sophocles

text: Love is never wrong.
author: Melissa Etheridge

text: I'm killing two birds at once, so to speak. Animal-based food kills people. This way, by going vegan... we get healthy and save animals. I'm being selfish, too, because if I can get my employees healthier, we cut down on sick days and gain more productivity.
author: Steve Wynn

text: In the stillness of your presence, you can feel your own formless and timeless reality as the unmanifested life that animates your physical form. You can then feel the same life deep within every other human and every other creature. You look beyond the veil of form and separation. This is the realization of oneness. This is love.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: Expect problems and eat them for breakfast.
author: Alfred A. Montapert

text: Heaven knows that I have done all that a mortal could do, to save the people, and the failure was not my fault, but the fault of others.
author: Davy Crockett

text: What is fascinating about marriage is why anyone wants to get married.
author: Alain de Botton

text: Being nerdy just means being passionate about something, including everyone - the coolest people on Earth are passionate and therefore nerdy about something whatever it is, whether it's sports, or gaming, or technology, or fashion, or beauty, or food, or whatever.
author: Zachary Levi

text: I believe that if life gives you lemons, you should make lemonade... And try to find somebody whose life has given them vodka, and have a party.
author: Ron White

text: I've failed over and over and over again in my life and that is why I succeed.
author: Michael Jordan

text: If a man does not make new acquaintances as he advances through life, he will soon find himself left alone. A man, sir, should keep his friendship in a constant repair.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: To me, the failure of liberalism - the tradition I come from - was not recognizing there has to be justice across the generations.
author: Richard Lamm

text: Obstacles are necessary for success because in selling, as in all careers of importance, victory comes only after many struggles and countless defeats.
author: Og Mandino

text: For me, 'Lamb' started out as a further exploration of the phenomenon of faith and the responsibility of a messiah that I touched on in 'Coyote Blue' and 'Island of the Sequined Love Nun,' but it ended up being an exploration of the true meaning of sacrifice, loyalty, and friendship.
author: Christopher Moore

text: Part of being a man is learning to take responsibility for your successes and for your failures. You can't go blaming others or being jealous. Seeing somebody else's success as your failure is a cancerous way to live.
author: Kevin Bacon

text: Success and failure are both part of life. Both are not permanent.
author: Shah Rukh Khan

text: There is nothing wrong with your marriage if you're dealing with bills and kids and the broken garbage disposal and in-laws and work demands. That's a normal marriage.
author: Phil McGraw

text: I chose 'No. 1 Ladies' Detective,' or I'll say it chose me, and it was an absolute blessing, for the experience of being in Africa for seven months and learning so many different things, from languages to foods to greetings. On so many levels, it was an incredible experience.
author: Jill Scott

text: Owners of dogs will have noticed that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they will think you are God. Whereas owners of cats are compelled to realize that, if you provide them with food and water and affection, they draw the conclusion that they are God.
author: Christopher Hitchens

text: My definition of success is to live your life in a way that causes you to feel a ton of pleasure and very little pain - and because of your lifestyle, have the people around you feel a lot more pleasure than they do pain.
author: Tony Robbins

text: There can be no permanent progress in the battle against hunger until the agencies that fight for increased food production and those that fight for population control unite in a common effort.
author: Norman Borlaug

text: I always say centered food equals centered behavior.
author: Marilu Henner

text: When people read 'Breitbart' every single day and convince themselves that Barack Obama is a foreign terrorist, that is not a problem of government. That is a problem of community failure, and we have to recognize that.
author: J. D. Vance

text: My wife and I have what's known as mixed marriage. I am a Methodist, she is a Muslim. So we're keeping it in the M's.
author: Grover Norquist

text: A lot of the powerful religious leaders, from Jesus to Buddha to Tibetan monks, they're really talking about the same things: love and acceptable, and the value of friendship, and respecting yourself so you can respect others.
author: Jena Malone

text: I want to have fun. It's a beautiful life. You learn, you win, you lose, but you get up.
author: Nas

text: Marriage: A friendship recognized by the police.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: I certainly want campaign finance reform. I just wish this would do it in a way that would stand up to a constitutional challenge.
author: Ben Nelson

text: We all have life storms, and when we get the rough times and we recover from them, we should celebrate that we got through it. No matter how bad it may seem, there's always something beautiful that you can find.
author: Mattie Stepanek

text: Fourth Law of Thermodynamics: If the probability of success is not almost one, then it is damn near zero.
author: David R. Ellis

text: Man should not try to avoid stress any more than he would shun food, love or exercise.
author: Hans Selye

text: In matters of the heart, nothing is true except the improbable.
author: Madame de Stael

text: We can't destroy the inequities between men and women until we destroy marriage.
author: Robin Morgan

text: All food is comfort food. Maybe I just like to chew.
author: Lewis Black

text: The government that came into power after the April 1994 elections was going to need a budget. It was drafted by our finance minister, Derek Keys, and he convinced them of the necessity to stay within the free-market principles that had been in force in South Africa for decades.
author: F. W. de Klerk

text: Success is not greedy, as people think, but insignificant. That is why it satisfies nobody.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

text: I'm still at the beginning of my career. It's all a little new, and I'm still learning as I go.
author: Orlando Bloom

text: Of course, learning is strengthened and solidified when it occurs in a safe, secure and normal environment.
author: Jean-Bertrand Aristide

text: Let's face it, a nice creamy chocolate cake does a lot for a lot of people; it does for me.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Monks will have three begging bowls for their food: one for water, one for liquid food, one for dry food.
author: Satish Kumar
